subject: fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-28 21:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-28 22:00:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nHere's the fix for the broken Cinder CSI we recently backported :) Apologies for merging things in this order, this should have gone in first."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-29 21:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-29 22:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-28 21:59:06.000000000', 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)
'}]
commit_message:
fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)

'}, {'created': '2020-03-29 16:29:16.000000000', 'message': "[ceph-daemons] Redirect all the logs to stdout

This is to redirect all the logs from daemons to stdout to avoid
accumulating large sized log files on filesystem.

NOTE: The ceph-osd daemon won't work this way and is addressed

daemons are included here.

Change-Id: I3045d6e941791aba14979472fac1bca09776d3bf

commit_message:
[ceph-daemons] Redirect all the logs to stdout

This is to redirect all the logs from daemons to stdout to avoid
accumulating large sized log files on filesystem.

NOTE: The ceph-osd daemon won't work this way and is addressed
separately in https://review.opendev.org/715295. All other Ceph
daemons are included here.

Change-Id: I3045d6e941791aba14979472fac1bca09776d3bf

commit_message:
Ceph-OSD: Add log tailer to ceph-osd

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

Change-Id: Idbe03d4123f86b1b88e277fea6d13f58104f94b0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
If only .pyc exist, the extension API will be disabled

In some commercial production environments, generally will not expose the
source code, this means that only .pyc files exist in the environment.In
this case, the extension API cannot be loaded.

Closes-Bug:#1869148
Change-Id: Id5238e7efe5ff0b80197ac0afa9f5f7a73239f20
(cherry picked from commit 8c582d87912270afa37371bbb202ae98dc1d375c)
(cherry picked from commit 6b3daf4814cac704a4a112a559f3e36121a0e532)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 09:59:41.000000000', 'message': 'Change default listening address for health checks.

Currently, regardless of the version of the IP protocol used, health
check services for kuryr CNI and kuryr controller, are always listen on
0.0.0.0, which effectively means any interface. In this patch we propose
to chang that to include IPv6 address as well.

Change-Id: I96fc1033b93bd54b70c7caaa428076baf73b4207
'}]
commit_message:
Change default listening address for health checks.

Currently, regardless of the version of the IP protocol used, health
check services for kuryr CNI and kuryr controller, are always listen on
0.0.0.0, which effectively means any interface. In this patch we propose
to chang that to include IPv6 address as well.

Change-Id: I96fc1033b93bd54b70c7caaa428076baf73b4207

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iaa968bccc27575ab81b05066cfb8d34817cdf249

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 2.0 which
supports Python 3.

Blacklist:
W504 line break after binary operator

Fix:
E305 expected 2 blank lines after class or function definition, found 1

Change-Id: I713186061d5484ee2cd5317eb9192646fd3a1099

commit_message:
Prepare Server to be used in cloud layer

One step to use server resource in the cloud layer. Expansion stuff is 
added. It is intended to return plain server Serource without 
normalization, for that it receives all the stuff we currently add in 
the cloud layer. After this is merged the finalization of cloud._compute 
will be a bit smaller.

Change-Id: I6fbdb25610dba69b95df8f09a39fd6606866561d

commit_message:
Allow setting volume attach status

This feature was available in the Cinder client however it does
not exist in OpenStack client.

This patch adds the ability to use `--attach-status` to reset the
attach status of a volume using the Cinder API.

Change-Id: I2631e326a0e693deccfc95df149115442765bf3d
Closes-Bug: #1745699

commit_message:
os-traits: release 2.3.0

Release os-traits 2.3.0 to pick up following fixes:
  - Switch to hacking 2.x [1]
  - Remove use of six [2]
  - setup.cfg: Remove unused 'build_sphinx' configuration [3]
  - setup.cfg: Configure 'python-requires' [4]

[1] bca5bace0717aac6b60b49ce928d7b35b0b3cb96
[2] 865cf20732383b494ebf410ec6b4b3577bb3dd20
[3] c4ee198eb7f95f7192d9d5dcb157289848bc2506
[4] e3e20d435e0f8cf887da1eb0497f66b5052274af

Change-Id: I188b61b28877059c11af71438228ba1cdf32a356

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I7c7796c3da01af546d3631d1bfc398b7d7d933fb
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 17:54:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I510fbc4ee923cee005826cf81220f9e6e0549c9d
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I510fbc4ee923cee005826cf81220f9e6e0549c9d

commit_message:
[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its
tasks skipped. This gives us results sooner and burns less
electricity, making the world a better place. :)

Change-Id: I6ae5a63051d512eecb2a603af9d74ec139eb0877
(cherry picked from commit 6535d6eafa651a526451a3bd31215be8c44115a7)

commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)

commit_message:
Added new project openstack-tempest-skiplist

It creates the openstack-tempest-skiplist and import existing
skiplist from openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras project to
openstack-tempest-skiplist.

It is a collection of skipped tempest tests which is initially
started by TripleO team and will be shared with OSA and other
projects.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/714030

Change-Id: Id9648164023590a440c56906ecd982523b176179
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] ceph-mon: Add log tailer to ceph-mon

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

Change-Id: I7237f68681f52220b6e1889ff98e2a278de15661

commit_message:
Remove mysql dependency

The module does only rely on the mysql
module implictly through the openstacklib
module which means its not a direct dependency.

This value is always outdated since we bumped
the dependency in [1]. This probably needs to
be fixed in other modules as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710523/

Change-Id: Ic6d4794e7960059d70534c1cbcc12f4e933ad1a4

Thanks, Madhuri. This looks interesting! I have a couple of questions/concerns added inline.'}, {'account_id': 7900, 'date': '2019-07-24 20:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(17 comments)

Thank you for reviewing.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-07-25 08:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we need to make explicit that the individual deploy_steps need to take care of *how* changes are applied, i.e. via an OOB command, via IPMI, ... in other words, this change proposes means to execute steps on active nodes, but it does not introduce a framework that would allow in-band commands to be run (like it would typically be required for BIOS changes).'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-07-25 09:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the feedback. I will include this detail in next update.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-07-30 09:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-07-30 09:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I think we need to make explicit that the individual deploy_steps
 > need to take care of *how* changes are applied, i.e. via an OOB
 > command, via IPMI, ... in other words, this change proposes means
 > to execute steps on active nodes, but it does not introduce a
 > framework that would allow in-band commands to be run (like it
 > would typically be required for BIOS changes).

Done.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-08-01 07:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-08-05 14:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thank you Madhuri. Few comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-08-08 09:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-08-08 09:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-10 15:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Finally got to reviewing this, sorry for the wait.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-10 15:40:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

IMO there are lots of cases where this might not do what a user expects.

* if a trait is 'removed' from a node, how would we 'undo' the matching deploy template?

* can we always assume that running only one of a set of deploy templates matched by a flavor will do what is expected?

* can we assume that deploy steps will work when executed against an active node? I suppose if we mark them as supporting reconfigure as dtantsur says it could work."}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-09-30 09:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-09-30 09:35:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)

Thank you, Mark and Dmitry for reviewing the spec.

commit_message:
Add support for node reconfigure

This spec proposes to allow Ironic users to perform reconfiguration
of an active node.

Change-Id: I6ddc02fdfb9b9d7e020fe9f724df56a18dd294ba
Story: 2005129
Task: 29803

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c

commit_message:
Add show_image_direct_url when glance_backend_ceph is true

When use ceph as the backend storage of glance, the
'show_image_direct_url' must be set to True when
would like to use copy-on-write in the ceph offical
documents

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c

'}, {'created': '2019-06-24 20:30:42.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- This is to move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Check for backfill/recover between  osd restarts so that performance of
  the ceph cluster will not be degraded .

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg backfill/recover status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking ceph cluster between pod
  restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[wip]Ceph-OSD: Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- Move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg  status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking for pg status before picking
  osd for restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Create rack based daemonset and configmap

This is to extend the host override functionaity to create rack based
daemonset along with list of nodes belongs to that rack sothat single
ds will spawn the pods on rack.

This will be helpful when we enable rack based failure domians since
upgrades will first bring down the pods belongs to respective racks.

Change-Id: I92f37fa169322894185325e69153dc20da1b17a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 15:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)

commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)

commit_message:
Cap Pygments for python 2.7

The last Pygments release to support python 2 is 2.5.2, so our
python 2 tests are failing running the latest version 2.6.1.

Change-Id: I40c8d0a308188e6d007bfd9d700c2c3c3f57b1f3

commit_message:
Deprecate legacy way to retrieve neutron usage

neutron 'quota_details' extension was added in Pike to provide
a convenient way to retrieve resource usage in neutron without listing
individual resources. It was added in Pike release and we will have
six releases since then once Ussuri release is shipped. Enough time has
passed to migrate it to the new mechanism, so it is time to deprecate
the legacy way for future cleanup.

Change-Id: Ie0b4613bf9fdcd96481b3bb1139b4fb153bfef83

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19560, 'date': '2019-12-12 14:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Slawek Kaplonski â IPv4-compatible and IPv4-mapped addresses should be never sent across the wire (even virtual). The only purpose of these addresses is to masquerade IPv4-addresses to be usable across IPv6-sockets, so an application could bind to a single socket and talk both to IPv4- and IPv6-world.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-13 03:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19560, 'date': '2019-12-13 07:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Akihiro Motoki â if you enable IPv6 on an interface, it would get two IPv6 addresses; one for link-local connectivity (auto-generated from MAC using EUI-64) and another router address for everything else (which is usually referred as "VM IP"). That another address is usually configured using either autoconf (by kernel processing the RA from the router), or by DHCPv6 client. If you attempt to make a connection to a link-local address (such as the proposed address of the metadata service, fe80::a9fe:a9fe%eth0), it would originate from the link-local address of the interface. So the metadata service would get a packet with VM's MAC in L2 and EUI-64'ed VM's MAC in L3, never seeing a normal "VM IP" in L3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-16 06:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Dmitry Bilunov,
Apart from the content of your reply, could you use inline comment rather than the cover comment? Using the cover comment makes it hard to track discussions.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-16 06:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

I will stop my comments and just update this spec, mostly just text nits.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-03-19 22:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-03-19 22:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 22584, 'date': '2020-03-20 08:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-03-24 14:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

So how about using some ULA space instead of link-local? Using a generator on the web I drew fd8a:1265:0189:b9e4::/64 so that would make fd8a:1265:0189:b9e4::a9fe:a9fe our well-known address. Inserting a static route for that should work better.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-03-24 17:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> So how about using some ULA space instead of link-local? Using a
 > generator on the web I drew fd8a:1265:0189:b9e4::/64 so that would
 > make fd8a:1265:0189:b9e4::a9fe:a9fe our well-known address.
 > Inserting a static route for that should work better.

I am not an expert but if i understand well ULA is globally unique (see: https://networkengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/30128/ipv6-ula-vs-link-local ) can't that cause problem here? At least from user/admin perspective?"}, {'account_id': 22584, 'date': '2020-03-24 18:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-03-25 08:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-03-25 10:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

Good catch.
I need AI hardened glasses for IPv6.
I reproduced Bence's trial (after another hour of bad address in one of my commands), so I think the PoC setup can work in real life as well."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-03-25 11:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22584, 'date': '2020-03-25 15:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> (1 comment)

You are welcome Bence!

I would ask if the IPv6 route installation at line 61 in etherpad:
vm0 $ sudo ip -6 r add fe80::a9fe:a9fe via fe80::f816:3eff:fe90:2c07 dev ens2

was actually never used later. In all calls (ping and curl) from the VM, you are always specifying %ens2 (%25ens2), which bypasses additionally added route (inside the virtual machine).'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-03-26 14:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I will just +1 this as I was editing this spec recently :)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Disable openstack-support job

This PS disables openstack-support as a gating job and moves it to
nonvoting check due to the failures which are not related to the
changes in PSs.

Change-Id: I10a5108679bc06bdfc287006753584100175d5b6

commit_message:
Have middlewarearchitecture doc reference auth_type option

We literally say in (the rendered version of) the same doc:

 # Authentication type to load (string value)
 # Deprecated group/name - [keystone_authtoken]/auth_plugin
 #auth_type = <None>

Looks like auth_plugin has been deprecated for quite some time:
https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/a56ed4218

Change-Id: I2dafa0cb28f017667497e0a6585d96a8cd090d5f

[{'created': '2020-03-27 15:56:05.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup Python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove section from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Update requirements

Change-Id: Ibca03f9ebaeaca595e027be9cb5900c368c8de6d
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup Python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove section from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Update requirements

Change-Id: Ibca03f9ebaeaca595e027be9cb5900c368c8de6d

Did you just try the same mounts looking at the atomic system container?'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-28 09:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-28 09:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Spyros I did not 100% understand your 2 bullet point list but I have updated the commit message with a small point that did make sense to me. Let me know if this works for you?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-28 11:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-28 11:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks, looking forward to have csi-cinder wokring with SELinux.
 > 
 > Also, how did you come with the fix. Did you just try the same
 > mounts looking at the atomic system container?

Someone on CPO responded saying they spun up a cluster using kubeadm on FCOS and they were not able to reproduce this issue so I realised it must be related to the way we configure kubelet. At first, I only tried mounting /etc/selinux, /var/lib/selinux and /sys/fs/selinux but this did not work... so I thought I would try one last thing and mount /:/rootfs as we used to do in Atomic and this did the trick.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-28 21:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 11:32:19.000000000', 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the /rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

PS: The default behaviour in Fedora Atomic was to mount the rootfs [1]
but we dropped it for some reason in Fedora CoreOS. However, it seems
like we really need it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69

commit_message:
fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69

Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 2.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Change-Id: I81cf5e317bb2f791888e75d87cfd27dfdd2b5f96

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7020, 'name': 'Joe Hakim Rahme', 'email': 'jhakimra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rahmu'}, {'_account_id': 8864, 'name': 'Artom Lifshitz', 'email': 'alifshit@redhat.com', 'username': 'artom'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27478, 'name': 'Archit Modi', 'email': 'amodi@redhat.com', 'username': 'amodi'}, {'_account_id': 31033, 'name': 'James Parker', 'email': 'jparker@redhat.com', 'username': 'jparker'}, {'_account_id': 31239, 'name': 'Paras Babbar', 'email': 'pbabbar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pbabbar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:36:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-25 23:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-26 01:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-26 05:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-26 11:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-26 12:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-26 13:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Summarizing the GMeet discussion:

We need to standardize on terminology:

1. 'hypervisor' is used in Nova to refer to the actual host running the VMs (or baremetal instances), and is different from the compute host, even if in the libvirt case it's a 1:1 mapping (for Ironic and I believe vcenter it's 1:many). We should stop using this word, because we never actually mean what it means in Nova.

2. We need two different kinds of addresses in our tests:

A compute_host address to force instances to land on a particular host (with the host argument in API 2.74). In all deployments, this should be the host field in the list-compute-services API.

A ctrlplane_address to SSH to a particular host. This is what we do currently with the CONF.hypervisors dict and the get_hypervisor_ip() method. Those should be renamed/refactored."}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-27 20:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-27 20:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-27 21:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(7 comments)

Few things noted inline, and pending CI obviously, but otherwise I very much like this.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-27 22:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-27 22:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-27 22:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-27 23:55:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

CI isn't happy, and I have some further nits :)"}, {'account_id': 31239, 'date': '2020-03-28 00:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I may have lost the whole picture here, but what was the reason of adding  separate method for fetching the compute hosts ? If we are anyways updating the ip from whitebox tempest.conf  which user has to update manually in director based deployment?'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 02:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)

I'm not really sure why the tests are failing for python 2.7, but I've got an environment locally that is recreating the problem so I will submit the updates when I solve the problem."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 02:10:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > I'm not really sure why the tests are failing for python 2.7, but
 > I've got an environment locally that is recreating the problem so I
 > will submit the updates when I solve the problem.

Ah, apologies, hadn't actually checked the test result. It's indeed unrelated to the patch, something about a --list option not existing."}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 02:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Paras In regards to changing the methods, get_all_hypervisors() returned a dynamic value, with devstack deployments it would be a hostname and with TripleO it would be an IP address.  If we wanted to map config changes to specific hostnames or force servers to land on specific hosts, TripleO deployments would have to always take extra steps to map the IP address back the the hostname.  The other reason for the change is to update the naming convention of hypervisors to control plane address since that is a more accurate description of how we would like to interact with the services. If we were working with ironic or vmware we could end up with a one to many mapping of control plane to hypervisor which not fit as well in the older naming model we were using.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 02:13:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > (5 comments)
 > >
 > > I'm not really sure why the tests are failing for python 2.7, but
 > > I've got an environment locally that is recreating the problem so
 > I
 > > will submit the updates when I solve the problem.
 > 
 > Ah, apologies, hadn't actually checked the test result. It's indeed
 > unrelated to the patch, something about a --list option not
 > existing.

Ah thanks for letting me know, I couldn't for the life of me figure out how the test changes could cause that error."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 02:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715587/3 should take care of the py27 issue - it did locally, at any rate.'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 16:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 17:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I suspect CI will fill again until you rebase on that py27 fix that landed recently :

  git remote update
  git rebase
  got review'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 18:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31239, 'date': '2020-03-28 18:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> @Paras In regards to changing the methods, get_all_hypervisors()
 > returned a dynamic value, with devstack deployments it would be a
 > hostname and with TripleO it would be an IP address.  If we wanted
 > to map config changes to specific hostnames or force servers to
 > land on specific hosts, TripleO deployments would have to always
 > take extra steps to map the IP address back the the hostname.  The
 > other reason for the change is to update the naming convention of
 > hypervisors to control plane address since that is a more accurate
 > description of how we would like to interact with the services. If
 > we were working with ironic or vmware we could end up with a one to
 > many mapping of control plane to hypervisor which not fit as well
 > in the older naming model we were using.

Ok, thanks!Understood! Changes lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 18:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(4 comments)

Assuming CI is happy, lgtm. Some nits inline, but they can be left for a follow up.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 19:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31033, 'date': '2020-03-28 19:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> recheck

Did this fail because of the cpu_topology ordering?                                                      
Reference:
'cpu_topology': {'nova_object.changes': ['sockets',                                                                                          'cores','threads'],

-----
Actual:
'cpu_topology': {'nova_object.changes': ['threads',                                                                     'cores',                                                                                            'sockets'],

Thats the only difference I see and I do not think this patch would have any impact on the testcase."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-03-28 19:48:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Yeah, there's a patch up to fix that, but it's currently sitting with a -1 from Sean to add unit tests. I'll get that sorted next week, just recheck for now."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 21:36:49.000000000', 'message': "Add 'DNS' check during SSHClient init

In TripleO deployments the Undercloud does not have the hostname entries
to do a proper DNS resolution of its associated compute nodes. Since the
return value from get_all_hypervisors() is dynamic based on the
deployment, either hypervisor hostname or control plane address, this
has the potential to cause problems. One problem would be attempting to
force a server to be scheduled to a specific hypervisor. Since the
server creation api requires the hypervisor hostname/internal ip
address, not the compute nodeâs control plane IP address, extra steps
would have to be taken in a TripleO environment to provide the correct
hostname. There have also been problems where a hostname is the only
parameter passed to the SSHClient which results in a failure to
establish a connection, Commit  #c0fe4394c0 is an example of this being
addressed. This commit attempts to make the get_all_hypervisors() call
be consistent across deployments and only return hypervisor hostname.

BaseWhiteboxComputeTest.get_all_hypervisors() has been changed to
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames(). For Devstack deployments its
functionality remains the same, but for TripleO deployments it will now
return hypervisor hostnames instead of the control plane addresses. A
new method was added to BaseWhiteboxComputeTest as well,
get_hypervisor_hostname() which performs the same functionality as
get_hypervisor_ip(), but returns the hostname instead of the control
plane IP address of the compute node.

clients.SSHClient has been updated to do a âDNSâ check on the provided
control_plane address during initialization. This is done through static
method _attempt_tempest_dns_lookup(). If the control_plane_address is
already a valid IP address or if it is a DevStack deployment no action
is necessary and will set the control_plane_address of the object to the
provided value. If it is a TripleO deployment, it attempts to translate
the control_plane_adress hostname value to itâs IP address and use that
for the SSHClient object instead.

NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning and
VolumesAdminNegativeTest.test_detach_failure were both updated to use
these new methods when applicable. And test_base.py was updated to test
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames() instead of get_all_hypervisors().

Change-Id: I4660043fcccec6721e197c4d77390744e356c59e

"}, {'created': '2020-03-27 20:49:06.000000000', 'message': "Convert to compute services name scheme

Hypervisor naming scheme was 'split' into two distinct address values.
The first is compute host names which are derived from
list-compute-services API [1]. The second address value is the compute
control plane address that the tempest execution host will use to access
compute hosts. From BaseWhiteboxComputeTest get_hypervisor_ip and
get_all_hypervisors have been replaced with get_ctrlplane_address and
list_compute_hosts respectively. Unlike get_hypervisor_ip,
get_ctrlplane_address does not take a server id when finding a host ip,
but instead takes a compute hostname. list_compute_hosts returns all
service hostnames with binary name 'nova-compte' from the
list-compute-services API.

Several testcases from test_cpu_pinning.NUMALiveMigrationTest were
updated to use the new methods accordingly. One key change is every test
that calls list_compute_hosts, explicitly tries to convert returned
hostname to it's controlplane address. This is done because TripleO does
not have DNS entries for the compute hostnames and needs an IP address
when utilizing the whitebox.services module. test_volume_negative.py was
also updated to use the new methods when attempting to setup services.

test_base.py had its tests updated as well to work with the new methods.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-compute-services-detail#list-compute-services

Change-Id: I4660043fcccec6721e197c4d77390744e356c59e

commit_message:
Convert to compute services name scheme

Hypervisor naming scheme was 'split' into two distinct address values.
The first is compute host names which are derived from
list-compute-services API [1]. The second address value is the compute
control plane address that the tempest execution host will use to access
compute hosts. From BaseWhiteboxComputeTest get_hypervisor_ip and
get_all_hypervisors have been replaced with get_ctrlplane_address and
list_compute_hosts respectively. Unlike get_hypervisor_ip,
get_ctrlplane_address does not take a server id when finding a host ip,
but instead takes a compute hostname. list_compute_hosts returns all
service hostnames with binary name 'nova-compte' from the
list-compute-services API.

Several testcases from test_cpu_pinning.NUMALiveMigrationTest were
updated to use the new methods accordingly. One key change is every test
that calls list_compute_hosts, explicitly tries to convert returned
hostname to it's controlplane address. This is done because TripleO does
not have DNS entries for the compute hostnames and needs an IP address
when utilizing the whitebox.services module. test_volume_negative.py was
also updated to use the new methods when attempting to setup services.

test_base.py had its tests updated as well to work with the new methods.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-compute-services-detail#list-compute-services

Change-Id: I4660043fcccec6721e197c4d77390744e356c59e

commit_message:
Generalize clean step functions to support deploy steps

This change updates various agent cleaning functions to also
support deploy steps via a new step_type argument. It does not
yet make it possible to run in-band deploy steps.

The agent's get_clean_steps call has been modified to not fail
if there are no cached steps. This is going to be normal for
both cleaning and deploy in the future, and it is impossible
to hit now because of the way cleaning is started.

Change-Id: I789b130e7e490e23924338a024397973957272ac
Story: #2006963

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: I40a02b3378607eadab88fc8d3aa984dc86270864

[{'created': '2020-03-18 08:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Raise human-friendly messages on attempt to use pre-deploy steps drivers

This is a follow up to commit 529c3ff06693d0a1aa13081acff92010fe855c50.
It adds a proper exception on missing deploy steps and removes
compatibility code for trying to continue deploy in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I6dc176c12a913cb481164a90881bb1c3107b36eb
Story: #2006963
'}, {'created': '2020-03-18 12:47:59.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Raise human-friendly messages on attempt to use pre-deploy steps drivers

This is a follow up to commit 529c3ff06693d0a1aa13081acff92010fe855c50.
It adds a proper exception on missing deploy steps and removes
compatibility code for trying to continue deploy in DEPLOYING.

To make it work, the call to continue_node_deploy RPC is removed from
the end of the agent's reboot_and_finish_deploy. It's not needed with
deploy steps and it actually breaks splitting this call to a separate
step.

Change-Id: I6dc176c12a913cb481164a90881bb1c3107b36eb
Story: #2006963
"}, {'created': '2020-03-18 12:48:12.000000000', 'message': "Raise human-friendly messages on attempt to use pre-deploy steps drivers

compatibility code for trying to continue deploy in DEPLOYING.

the end of the agent's reboot_and_finish_deploy. It's not needed with
deploy steps and it actually breaks splitting this call to a separate
step.

Change-Id: I6dc176c12a913cb481164a90881bb1c3107b36eb

commit_message:
Raise human-friendly messages on attempt to use pre-deploy steps drivers

This is a follow up to commit 529c3ff06693d0a1aa13081acff92010fe855c50.
It adds a proper exception on missing deploy steps and provides a proper
deprecation for the compatibility code when trying to continue deploy
for a node in the DEPLOYING state.

Change-Id: I6dc176c12a913cb481164a90881bb1c3107b36eb
Story: #2006963

(1 comment)

Hongbin, reading the spec I got a feel of Murano application packaging. I just want to make sure we are not duplicating any effort.
Murano also has same application packaging. However I am not sure of Murano's project roadmap, future :)"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hongbin, reading the spec I got a feel of Murano application
 > packaging. I just want to make sure we are not duplicating any
 > effort.
 > Murano also has same application packaging. However I am not sure
 > of Murano's project roadmap, future :)

Madhuri,

Good point. Actually, I have looked into Murano and evaluated their approach before proposing this spec. Murano does introduce their own packaging format and their DSL for packaging VM applications. An alternative approach for us is to use Murano to package Zun applications.

However, I don't propose to use Murano because they have been selling their packaging format for years but it doesn't seem to be successful. In comparison, the Chart packaging format from Helm is proven to very successful and popular. By analyzing these two different packaging format, I think Chart format is more straightforward and developer-friendly. Chart adopts the Go template language which is easy to pick up, flexible, and standardized. In comparison, Murano's DSL is not a standard DSL (it is Murano-specific). It looks complex and heavy. I guess that is the reason why it doesn't succeed (so far).

Therefore, I prefer Chart format and proposes a Helm-like approach. However, feel free to comment if there are alternative points of view for this."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-02 23:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-03 00:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-12-03 19:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2017-12-08 11:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Hongbin, reading the spec I got a feel of Murano application
 > > packaging. I just want to make sure we are not duplicating any
 > > effort.
 > > Murano also has same application packaging. However I am not sure
 > > of Murano's project roadmap, future :)
 > 
 > Madhuri,
 > 
 > Good point. Actually, I have looked into Murano and evaluated their
 > approach before proposing this spec. Murano does introduce their
 > own packaging format and their DSL for packaging VM applications.
 > An alternative approach for us is to use Murano to package Zun
 > applications.
 > 
 > However, I don't propose to use Murano because they have been
 > selling their packaging format for years but it doesn't seem to be
 > successful. In comparison, the Chart packaging format from Helm is
 > proven to very successful and popular. By analyzing these two
 > different packaging format, I think Chart format is more
 > straightforward and developer-friendly. Chart adopts the Go
 > template language which is easy to pick up, flexible, and
 > standardized. In comparison, Murano's DSL is not a standard DSL (it
 > is Murano-specific). It looks complex and heavy. I guess that is
 > the reason why it doesn't succeed (so far).
 > 
 > Therefore, I prefer Chart format and proposes a Helm-like approach.
 > However, feel free to comment if there are alternative points of
 > view for this.

Thank you Hongbin for the details. Could you also add this in spec about not choosing Murano for others to read?"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-03-28 19:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2020-03-27 14:40:21.000000000', 'message': 'Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158
(cherry picked from commit 242775ae184582ce51a006e5797e7017133617f3)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158
(cherry picked from commit 242775ae184582ce51a006e5797e7017133617f3)

commit_message:
Add base image overrides to mini-mirror image

This adds environment variables for the build script that can be set
to individually override the base ubuntu build image for mini-mirror
as well as the final nginx image. This does not change the deafult
functionality and allows the mini-mirror build to be more configurable
if the end user wishes to substitute in their own images

Change-Id: I49e0415354ce8953b759de92367849b8f9ece50b

commit_message:
Fix autogenerated db migrations

This trys to fix the inconsistent between database and models.

[alembic.autogenerate.compare]:
* Detected removed index 'uniq_compute_node0rp_uuid' on 'compute_node'
* Detected added foreign key (capsule_id)(id) on table container
* Detected added unique constraint 'uniq_image0repotag' on '['repo', 'tag']'
* Detected removed index 'uniq_image0repotaghost' on 'image'
* Detected NULL on column 'quota_usages.resource'
* Detected added index 'ix_quota_usages_resource' on '['resource']'
* Detected NULL on column 'registry.domain'

Change-Id: I2a0aad5e863466230602141b669e6d1cab0e9221

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its

(cherry picked from commit 6535d6eafa651a526451a3bd31215be8c44115a7)
'}]
commit_message:
[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its
tasks skipped. This gives us results sooner and burns less
electricity, making the world a better place. :)

Change-Id: I6ae5a63051d512eecb2a603af9d74ec139eb0877
(cherry picked from commit 6535d6eafa651a526451a3bd31215be8c44115a7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 20:36:58.000000000', 'message': "Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)
"}]
commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Safeguarding retype to some in-use replicated modes

Host assisted migration is a better option for retyping from a non-replicated
to a replicated (Asynchronous and Metro) modes.

1. Block in-use non-replicated to replicated(Metro and Asynchronous)
2. Remove any unused code
3. Differentiate between the production and the management storage groups
4. Remove rollback code on a cleanup_lun, its not necessary on delete and
    will not always work
5. Allow for a target device not to exist on the target array
6. Fix minor issue on metadata on a retype

Change-Id: I6c7c94528ee94183c1df21c25388505b28f1781a

commit_message:
Have 1 dhcp agent per network

Because we don't support clustered undercloud, we need only one dpch
agent per network.

Change-Id: Ic6e8989fccf674124143b058affefd574339009b

commit_message:
Add cinder_csi_enabled label

Add support for out of tree Cinder CSI. This is installed when the
cinder_csi_enabled=true label is added. This will allow us to eventually
deprecate in-tree Cinder.

story: 2007048
task: 37868

Change-Id: I8305b9f8c9c37518ec39198693adb6f18542bf2e
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>
(cherry picked from commit 9565984fd90af340462d3b388e9137001da77133)

[{'created': '2020-03-27 16:23:49.000000000', 'message': "Stop installing test-requirements with projects

This is a test of installing openstack and then seeing if it works.
OpenStack components do not need test-requirements to operate,
that's why they are test-requirements.

Additionally, as we look forward to depsolver pip, this is going
to screw us because we don't apply constraints to linters, which
are expressed in - you guessed it, test-requirements.

Change-Id: I8f24b839bf42e2fb9803dc7df3a30ae20cf264eb
"}]
commit_message:
Stop installing test-requirements with projects

This is a test of installing openstack and then seeing if it works.
OpenStack components do not need test-requirements to operate,
that's why they are test-requirements.

Additionally, as we look forward to depsolver pip, this is going
to screw us because we don't apply constraints to linters, which
are expressed in - you guessed it, test-requirements.

Change-Id: I8f24b839bf42e2fb9803dc7df3a30ae20cf264eb

commit_message:
Signal agent token is required

The agent needs to be able to understand
if the agent token is supported and is a
mandatory feature of the ironic deployment
as that can alter some of the behavior of
the agent itself.

Also adds documentation on the subject for
administrators.

Story: 2007025
Task: 37821

Change-Id: Ic635e0ed6d378d6a34a4a82e66ca647eee33bc26

commit_message:
Do not redirect stderr to stdout

Warning messages to stderr will break simplistic redirects of stderr to
stdout. Use Exception.stderr for exception logging.

Change-Id: I4f6ff790bdee568b220b3ba495bab6b4c5304618

commit_message:
Add openstacksdk and python-openstackclient to integrated

openstacksdk and python-openstackclient are fundamental parts
of the integrated gate, but currently can't do full-on depends-on
processing because they're not in the integrated queue.

Change-Id: Id279ca855da4f874d5f99304aba86907c8875650

commit_message:
Cap stestr at 2.6.0 for python27

The last stestr version to support Python 2.7 is 2.6.0. This has not
caused problems until recently, when we started seeing the py27 job
fail with the following error:

run.py discover: error: no such option: --list

This patch caps stestr to 2.6.0 when running with Python 2.7. It also
adds test-requirements.txt to the devstack job's irrelevant-files to
avoid wasting gate resources.

Change-Id: Ic05622530acdeb87d40e183e3e988042468c11d9

commit_message:
Add Pygments to upper-constraints

Pygments is already in global-requirements, but not in
upper-constraints. Pygments is required by Sphinx.

Pygments removed support for py2 in version 2.6.0 so we
need to ensure that it is properly pinned to prevent
tests/docs failing.

Pygments was added to the blacklist in
I643c7632a02c87820c9c51f03fa34f0764384783 but it's not
entirely clear why. To ensure that it is managed in
upper-constraints from now on, we remove it from the
blacklist.

Change-Id: I18a50482e588176047ede81c4ee994c9d7df282b
Closes-Bug: #1869174

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 06:52:21.000000000', 'message': 'Rework how we push the content in the file

Since we allow to pass lists, we can't just use |join('').

In addition, using the multi-line support in YAML via the "|" creates
some issues when we want to use |join('\n'): it gets escaped, meaning we
end with a one-line content with some \n entries.

The present patch ensures that:
- generated content is still pushed in a fact to not lose time
- static content (lists) is properly treated and outputs correctly

Closes-Bug: #1868588
Change-Id: I7e520035f24503e59840b34e5b2d9e9966cd6ca4
(cherry picked from commit 75ed35c46a3368c19ff7aa14c13609fdf7008255)
'}]
commit_message:
Rework how we push the content in the file

Since we allow to pass lists, we can't just use |join('').

In addition, using the multi-line support in YAML via the "|" creates
some issues when we want to use |join('\n'): it gets escaped, meaning we
end with a one-line content with some \n entries.

The present patch ensures that:
- generated content is still pushed in a fact to not lose time
- static content (lists) is properly treated and outputs correctly

Closes-Bug: #1868588
Change-Id: I7e520035f24503e59840b34e5b2d9e9966cd6ca4
(cherry picked from commit 75ed35c46a3368c19ff7aa14c13609fdf7008255)

commit_message:
Disable fact gathering for create_admin

The create_admin execution doesn't require facts as the tasks are
static. Fact gather can be a long time on systems with large number of
network interfaces or storage volumes. This can lead to timeouts when
doing actions like scaling or deploying.

Change-Id: I0ff270dfabab2ef6926b8d2818ef5087eb03bed9
Closes-Bug: #1869018
(cherry picked from commit 32bc45c293c3ad9e24a803dfd82042efa81efdfe)

commit_message:
Bump pyScss upper constraint to 1.3.6

pyScss < 1.3.6 breaks with setuptools >= 46.0.0
has been fixed in master but needs to be bumped
for rocky

Fixes:https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1866961ed
Related : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714450/

Change-Id: I93e2ff9fb848cccb705e9879497b4c35797f8fc8

commit_message:
Disable fact gathering for create_admin

The create_admin execution doesn't require facts as the tasks are
static. Fact gather can be a long time on systems with large number of
network interfaces or storage volumes. This can lead to timeouts when
doing actions like scaling or deploying.

Change-Id: I0ff270dfabab2ef6926b8d2818ef5087eb03bed9
Closes-Bug: #1869018
(cherry picked from commit 32bc45c293c3ad9e24a803dfd82042efa81efdfe)

'}, {'created': '2020-03-26 11:43:38.000000000', 'message': "WIP Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

If for some reason (we've hit this via
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1694723) /etc/nftables/*
rules get populated and the nftables service is started and enabled
(which it is by puppet)
we'll effectively end up having two separate firewalls: the iptables one
managed by puppet and the nftables one left in the hands of the rpm
defaults.

We need to make sure that nftables is not set up, since that will
effectively interfere with the puppet-firewall/tripleo-ansible firewall
modules.

To do so we empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf (that way if this
code runs before the nftables rpm is installed it won't be
overwritten), then if the nftables.conf files has changed we flush
the nft rulesets and immediately reload the iptables services

Closes-Bug: #1869166
Change-Id: Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981
"}, {'created': '2020-03-26 12:35:59.000000000', 'message': "WIP Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

rules get populated and the nftables service is started and enabled
(which it is by puppet)
we'll effectively end up having two separate firewalls: the iptables one
managed by puppet and the nftables one left in the hands of the rpm
defaults.

We need to make sure that nftables is not set up, since that will
effectively interfere with the puppet-firewall/tripleo-ansible firewall
modules.

To do so we empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf (that way if this
code runs before the nftables rpm is installed it won't be
overwritten), then if the nftables.conf files has changed we flush
the nft rulesets and immediately reload the iptables services

Tested by deploying UC and OC on both rhel 8.1 and rhel8.2 and
then redeploying the UC and confirming that the nftables flush+
iptables service reload is not triggered on redeploy:
TASK [Prevent Nftables to set up any rules] ****************************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:01 +0000 (0:00:00.127)       0:01:46.572 *
ok: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Flush Nftables rules when nftables.conf changed] *****************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.480)       0:01:47.052 *
skipping: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Restart iptables to restore firewall after flushing nftables] ****
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.130)       0:01:47.183 *
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=iptables.service)
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=ip6tables.service)

Closes-Bug: #1869166
Change-Id: Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

If for some reason (we've hit this via
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1694723) /etc/nftables/*
rules get populated and the nftables service is started and enabled
(which it is by puppet)
we'll effectively end up having two separate firewalls: the iptables one
managed by puppet and the nftables one left in the hands of the rpm
defaults.

We need to make sure that nftables is not set up, since that will
effectively interfere with the puppet-firewall/tripleo-ansible firewall
modules.

To do so we empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf (that way if this
code runs before the nftables rpm is installed it won't be
overwritten), then if the nftables.conf files has changed we flush
the nft rulesets and immediately reload the iptables services

Tested by deploying UC and OC on both rhel 8.1 and rhel8.2 and
then redeploying the UC and confirming that the nftables flush+
iptables service reload is not triggered on redeploy:
TASK [Prevent Nftables to set up any rules] ****************************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:01 +0000 (0:00:00.127)       0:01:46.572 *
ok: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Flush Nftables rules when nftables.conf changed] *****************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.480)       0:01:47.052 *
skipping: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Restart iptables to restore firewall after flushing nftables] ****
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.130)       0:01:47.183 *
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=iptables.service)
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=ip6tables.service)

Closes-Bug: #1869166
Change-Id: Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981

[{'created': '2020-03-27 15:27:10.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] HA Chassis Group: Ignore UPDATES when external_ids hasn't changed

The "old" parameter passed to the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()
method is a delta object and sometimes it does not contain the
"external_ids" column (because it hasn't changed).

The absence of that column was misleading that method into believe that
the "old" object was no longer a gateway chassis and that triggered some
changes in the HA group.

This patch is adding a check to verify that the "external_ids" column
has changed before acting on it, otherwise just ignore the update and
return.

Change-Id: I3f7de633e5546dc78c3546b9c34ea81d0a0524d3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-27 15:53:54.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] HA Chassis Group: Ignore UPDATES when external_ids hasn't changed

The "old" parameter passed to the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()
method is a delta object and sometimes it does not contain the
"external_ids" column (because it hasn't changed).

The absence of that column was misleading that method into believe that
the "old" object was no longer a gateway chassis and that triggered some
changes in the HA group. Changing the HA group resulted in the SRIOV
(external in OVN) ports to start flapping between the gateway chassis.

This patch is adding a check to verify that the "external_ids" column
has changed before acting on it, otherwise just ignore the update and
return.

Closes-Bug: #1869389
Change-Id: I3f7de633e5546dc78c3546b9c34ea81d0a0524d3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] HA Chassis Group: Ignore UPDATES when external_ids hasn't changed

The "old" parameter passed to the handle_ha_chassis_group_changes()
method is a delta object and sometimes it does not contain the
"external_ids" column (because it hasn't changed).

The absence of that column was misleading that method into believe that
the "old" object was no longer a gateway chassis and that triggered some
changes in the HA group. Changing the HA group resulted in the SRIOV
(external in OVN) ports to start flapping between the gateway chassis.

This patch is adding a check to verify that the "external_ids" column
has changed before acting on it, otherwise just ignore the update and
return.

Closes-Bug: #1869389
Change-Id: I3f7de633e5546dc78c3546b9c34ea81d0a0524d3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch default images to py3

We should be building the centos8/python3 images by default now. This
change updates the default yaml when --config-file is not specified to
`openstack overcloud image build`.  You can still build the centos7
images for older versions by specifying a centos7 based yaml set.

Change-Id: If9b1699a307d1d10eae113708a32b5841ee3e17f

commit_message:
Handle ipv6 addresses in etcd and cinder's backend_url

When configured to use an ipv6 address, the etcd URLs and the cinder
lock manager's backend_url need to include brackets around the address.

Closes-Bug: #1868284
Change-Id: I79f385f14b5904803cdc7fdd145afa2dbcef9c49
(cherry picked from commit aed9bda1b0b97305be3d147ded862f936253bac2)

Remove from setup.py ancient sections.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 14:53:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks

Libvirt v6.0.0 [1] will now fail to launch a domain when using qcow2
disks where the backing file format is not recorded in the qcow2
metadata.

There are some discussions upstream around relaxing this slightly [2]
but for now any attempt to launch an instance using qcow2 disks will
fail as Nova does not populate this value when creating the disk.

Nova needs to at a minimum start populating this field and depending on
the outcome of the thread upstream in Libvirt also potentially handle
the upgrade case where we may need to rebase existing disks in order to
update the metadata.

For now this change simply adds the backing_fmt option to the qemu-img
command line used to create these disks.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3615e8b39badf2a526996a69dc91a92b04cf262e
[2] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html

Partial-Bug: #1864020
Change-Id: I77ebada015f6522a300be4fa043fb8676458402b
(cherry picked from commit 0cfe9c81e3fe4d268c9949c6b8e873abab94a407)
(cherry picked from commit 7fd41e9b8c0f0f9cbccd63fbdbcc863de7db50f5)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks

Libvirt v6.0.0 [1] will now fail to launch a domain when using qcow2
disks where the backing file format is not recorded in the qcow2
metadata.

There are some discussions upstream around relaxing this slightly [2]
but for now any attempt to launch an instance using qcow2 disks will
fail as Nova does not populate this value when creating the disk.

Nova needs to at a minimum start populating this field and depending on
the outcome of the thread upstream in Libvirt also potentially handle
the upgrade case where we may need to rebase existing disks in order to
update the metadata.

For now this change simply adds the backing_fmt option to the qemu-img
command line used to create these disks.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3615e8b39badf2a526996a69dc91a92b04cf262e
[2] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html

Partial-Bug: #1864020
Change-Id: I77ebada015f6522a300be4fa043fb8676458402b
(cherry picked from commit 0cfe9c81e3fe4d268c9949c6b8e873abab94a407)
(cherry picked from commit 7fd41e9b8c0f0f9cbccd63fbdbcc863de7db50f5)

requires-python is old value and does not work, python-requires

'python-requires' is introduced from PEP440 and requires-python was old value

- https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires

Change-Id: I496973e204b4f486ba3ce13faed545faf6392762

commit_message:
Replace old requires-python with python-requires

requires-python is old value and does not work, python-requires
is right metadata.

'python-requires' is introduced from PEP440 and requires-python was old value
in PEP345.
- https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires
- https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/#requires-python

Change-Id: I496973e204b4f486ba3ce13faed545faf6392762

commit_message:
Fix imcomplete migration to CentOS8 in ut/lint

The previous change[1] was merged to migrate jobs from CentOS7 to
CentOS8, but it was in fact incomplete regarding the following points.
 - Check jobs run on CentOS8, while gate job only run on CentOS7
 - Library jobs are still voted by CentOS7 jobs

This patch fixes the imcomplete update to make sure that we use
CentOS8 for master jobs.

[1] fc189a89739c71f8cb4b8b3ba7c60333ff0735c6

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715336/
Change-Id: If47b8ec2a43fbf53079ed9029f339a8f904e763e

commit_message:
Add support for configuring Cumulus switches with NCLU

This extends the physical network configuration in Kayobe to configure
Cumulus physical switches using the nclu Ansible module.

commit_message:
Remove seed_hypervisor_libvirt_pool_capacity variable

This is ignored by Libvirt, so there is no need to pass it to the
libvirt-host role.

Note: omitting the capacity argument requires libvirt-host 1.3.1 or
later.

Change-Id: Id94e7b514ed36c8e042e56e8f1891d98f8371e5d
Story: 2007381
Task: 38957

commit_message:
Turn off test log capture for now

We're hitting memory pressure test failures on test nodes.
Hypothesis is that we've got things logging too much and buffering
to RAM. While we track that down, turn off auto-logging.

Change-Id: Ie124f8dbd18600508a4a99ef91a5e0f5df00093c

commit_message:
Change policy name of swap volume API

Change "os_compute_api:os-volumes-attachments:update" policy to
"os_compute_api:os-volumes-attachments:swap" as policy authentication
for swap volume API [1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711194/7/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py@93

Change-Id: I78555261aa89b9679c11a25c52f3b38713bd2bce

While OpenStack broadly only supports 3.6, openstacksdk
has a wider audience, including nodepool which still uses
3.5. So add the 3.5 unit tests back.

Use lower-constraints for py35 unit tests because the
upper-constraints have versions of things that have
droppped py35 support already.

commit_message:
Add python-requires entry indicating 3.5 is required

We require 3.5 now but we didn't add the metadata. Add it.

While OpenStack broadly only supports 3.6, openstacksdk
has a wider audience, including nodepool which still uses
3.5. So add the 3.5 unit tests back.

Use lower-constraints for py35 unit tests because the
upper-constraints have versions of things that have
droppped py35 support already.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715467/
Change-Id: I680e0bab5ba3af7be5e914ece64c6bd25d1f2191

[{'created': '2020-03-16 17:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'DHCPv6 - Use addr6_list in dnsmasq

Adds a new bool option dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list, when
enabled configuration for dnsmasq will be created with a
single dhcp-host entry specifying a list of ip addresses
allocated for a port.

Previously the dnsmasq dhcp-agent driver would write a
separate dhcp-host entry for each fixed-ip of a port in
the dnsmasq hosts file. The result of the previous
behaviour is that dnsmasq will only use one of the config
entries, i.e the first one matching the mac identifier.

The trade-off is that only a single dns_assignment will
be used for IPv6 addresses within the same subnet. (But
in practice, this was always the case since only the
first config entry would be used by dnsmasq.)

Why is this neccecary:
  This is done to enable ironic provisioning over IPv6
  using DHCPv6-stateful. For background info, please
  read dnsmasq-discuss thread:
http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q1/thread.html#13671

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py

Closes-Bug: #1861032
Change-Id: I833840e7daed2efa7efaece27cfd1ba28e0feb90
(cherry picked from commit 592c2f8d91c3172c75cc5a2464350891b0a303f1)

commit_message:
DHCPv6 - Use addr6_list in dnsmasq

Adds a new bool option dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list, when
enabled configuration for dnsmasq will be created with a
single dhcp-host entry specifying a list of ip addresses
allocated for a port.

Previously the dnsmasq dhcp-agent driver would write a
separate dhcp-host entry for each fixed-ip of a port in
the dnsmasq hosts file. The result of the previous
behaviour is that dnsmasq will only use one of the config
entries, i.e the first one matching the mac identifier.

The trade-off is that only a single dns_assignment will
be used for IPv6 addresses within the same subnet. (But
in practice, this was always the case since only the
first config entry would be used by dnsmasq.)

Why is this neccecary:
  This is done to enable ironic provisioning over IPv6
  using DHCPv6-stateful. For background info, please
  read dnsmasq-discuss thread:
http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q1/thread.html#13671

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py

Closes-Bug: #1861032
Change-Id: I833840e7daed2efa7efaece27cfd1ba28e0feb90
(cherry picked from commit 592c2f8d91c3172c75cc5a2464350891b0a303f1)

[{'created': '2019-10-30 15:17:54.000000000', 'message': "Fixes race condition in test_add_remove_fixed_ip

Currently race condition can occure in tempest.api.compute.servers.test_attach_interfaces.AttachInterfacesUnderV243Test.test_add_remove_fixed_ip
when floating IP added during resource preparation doesn't appear in the list of original IPs that is created at the beggining of the test, which then confuses the test
and floating ip is later recognized as fixed IP added in the test.
more details including log: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1752416

This change filters floating IPs from the list of original IPs and then only checks if count of all non floating IPs is as expected.

Change-Id: Ic3a3e0708714b6d6c9c226e641e1c520e5ebde9d
Signed-off-by: David SedlÃ¡k <dsedlak@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixes race condition in test_add_remove_fixed_ip

Currently race condition can occure in
tempest.api.compute.servers.test_attach_interfaces.
AttachInterfacesUnderV243Test.test_add_remove_fixed_ip
when floating IP added during resource preparation doesn't appear in
the list of original IPs that is created at the beggining of the test,
which then confuses the test
and floating ip is later recognized as fixed IP added in the test.
more details including log:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1752416

This change ensures possible floating IP added during server
creation is always present in the set of original IPs and also
during every comparasion of IPs.

Closes-Bug: #1866179

Change-Id: Ic3a3e0708714b6d6c9c226e641e1c520e5ebde9d
Signed-off-by: David SedlÃ¡k <dsedlak@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Run pip check at end of devstack"

This reverts commit 79b8e79488a6268f37244188ab831e99a99648c8.

This is breaking things in various jobs, most notably because
we do not put constraints on linters - but we install
test-requirements which then can conflict with each other.

Change-Id: Ibc5603c61b38ce44db58fb27a27352f59123ad09

commit_message:
Copy in python-openstackclient docs

This populates the project's docs with (almost) an exact copy of what's
in python-openstackclient at commit
977b0c8591e40d3f59bbc1af9adc75f2c2edb694.

The primary purpose of this is to allow us to (in a subsequent patch)
beef up the openstackclient-plugin-jobs template so that plugin projects
can't merge broken option helps anymore.

Note that we're still not publishing these docs. Before that happens, it
should undergo a read-through to sanity check that everything is
appropriately non-python-openstackclient-specific (particularly the
contributor/ section). If/once we do start publishing it, we should
remove the docs from python-openstackclient (adding redirects) so they
don't have to be maintained in both places.

Change-Id: I0fbba2baf021e666cba6a13c38e6152216ac5d7d

commit_message:
Use contraints for tempest plugins

This patch unifies the master branch with the changes which have
been necessary to unbreak the stable branches in light of py2 support
being removed from tempest and its plugins.

Change-Id: I1d447933af5b668c17576a0ed985683a28fa153a
(cherry picked from commit 9de0b7a59f150f5ef7bc9f85870edbafeedcbf10)

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output
- Update Berksfile for cookbook-bind to point to upstream since the PR
  was merged, but not released (yet).
- Ensure systemd-resolved is stopped and disabled

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027

commit_message:
Correct wrong template reference.

In [0] we cleaned up some variables that we barely used. However,
there was a mistake at the time of referencing the template to
build the overcloud_upgrade_run_x.sh script and the change referenced
to the overcloud_update_run template instead.

[0] - I443865bc95590a5cffcc28d98913110238e863b6

subject: k8s: Fix logic of when a cluster API is accessible
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-27 12:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-27 13:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-27 19:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 12:16:31.000000000', 'message': 'k8s: Fix logic of when a cluster API is accessible

At present, if floating_ip_enabled is true and master_lb_enabled is also
true but master_lb_fip_enabled is false, a cluster still resolves to
being accessible therefore resolves to an UNHEALTHY status when it
should be UNKNOWN. This patch fixes this edge case and also adds a unit
test to capture this issue.

Story: 2007242
Task: 39140

Change-Id: I74f7455e3caa920032080747a315470878ba5500
(cherry picked from commit fbaba6e00157c07ac984d3f8f167c810bc0c7c8f)
'}]
commit_message:
k8s: Fix logic of when a cluster API is accessible

At present, if floating_ip_enabled is true and master_lb_enabled is also
true but master_lb_fip_enabled is false, a cluster still resolves to
being accessible therefore resolves to an UNHEALTHY status when it
should be UNKNOWN. This patch fixes this edge case and also adds a unit
test to capture this issue.

Story: 2007242
Task: 39140

Change-Id: I74f7455e3caa920032080747a315470878ba5500
(cherry picked from commit fbaba6e00157c07ac984d3f8f167c810bc0c7c8f)

- Cookstyle fixes

  cookbooks

- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/heat/heat.conf] to

commit_message:
Update Python image builder job name

The system-config-build-image-python-builder job in
opendev/system-config was recently split into Python 3.7 and 3.8
versions. The old job no longer exists, so use the 3.7 one as that
matches what we're currently deploying.

Change-Id: I4b045a410d22972a26f68ce73beb6130d14dd0cb

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Add missing ChefSpec tests
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Cleanup array syntax using %w() instead of []
- Remove FWaaS recipe as it's been unmaintained upstream.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706101
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706151
Change-Id: Ie3b65b701235bae65a1797d63d6a55dd6fc9958e
