commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/ironic/ironic.conf] to
  resources improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Add missing ChefSpec tests
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Cleanup array syntax using %w() instead of []

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/nova/nova.conf] to
  resources improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Cleanup array syntax using %w() instead of []
- Add metadata to enabled_apis as that is the default upstream
- Switch to user resource for managing shell for nova user
- Switch to libvirtd instead of libvirt-bin for Ubuntu service name

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706151
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708059
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706157
Change-Id: I7e03fb9dace6e288a3b21f33106245b30b52ce9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 06:03:50.000000000', 'message': 'Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/neutron/neutron.conf] and
  template[/etc/neutron/metadata_agent.ini] to resources improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Update lbaas and fwaas recipes to use v2 agent driver for each.
- Add recommended configuration settings to neutron.conf based in Stein
  installation docs.
- Remove any resources that define the default action.
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Manage /etc/neutron/neutron_lbaas.conf so we can set service_provider
  properly.
- Add some missing ChefSpec tests.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706151
Change-Id: Id29884766440d37fa18fd62f3f93eecc22224d51
'}, {'created': '2020-03-11 00:24:19.000000000', 'message': "Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/neutron/neutron.conf] and
  template[/etc/neutron/metadata_agent.ini] to resources improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Update lbaas and fwaas recipes to use v2 agent driver for each.
- Add recommended configuration settings to neutron.conf based in Stein
  installation docs.
- Remove any resources that define the default action.
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Manage /etc/neutron/neutron_lbaas.conf so we can set service_provider
  properly.
- Add some missing ChefSpec tests.
- Configure neutron_lbaas.conf on Ubuntu in a manner that allows it to properly
  pull in the configuration via the --config-dir option. This is due to the fact
  we need to set an additional [service_providers] service_provider line and we
  can't do that with hashes.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Cleanup line wraps
- Enable sensitive resources for the template[/etc/neutron/neutron.conf] and
  template[/etc/neutron/metadata_agent.ini] to resources improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Fix ChefSpec output.
- Update lbaas recipe to use v2 agent driver.
- Add recommended configuration settings to neutron.conf based in Stein
  installation docs.
- Remove any resources that define the default action.
- Switch package installations to send packages as arrays instead of individual
  package resources. This generally speeds up chef runs.
- Manage /etc/neutron/neutron_lbaas.conf so we can set service_provider
  properly.
- Add some missing ChefSpec tests.
- Configure neutron_lbaas.conf on Ubuntu in a manner that allows it to properly
  pull in the configuration via the --config-dir option. This is due to the fact
  we need to set an additional [service_providers] service_provider line and we
  can't do that with hashes.
- Remove FWaaS as it's unmaintained upstream.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706151
Change-Id: Id29884766440d37fa18fd62f3f93eecc22224d51

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Enable sensitive resources for the execute resources in
  openstack_image_image and template[/etc/glance/glance-api.conf] to
  improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Set glance_store/stores, and update auth_type to password as described
  in the upstream documentation [1]
- Fix ChefSpec output

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/glance/stein/install/install-rdo.html#install-and-configure-components

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706151
Change-Id: I695b576267bc220b0b70011ab035520fc18ff955

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Cookstyle fixes
- Refactor Berksfile to use groups so we can exclude integration testing
  cookbooks
- Update documentation
- Enable sensitive resources for template[/etc/keystone/keystone.conf]
  and execute[bootstrap_keystone] to improve security.
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/stein/install/keystone-install-rdo.html#install-and-configure-components

commit_message:
removing old requirements, pin other reqs for 2.7

pin:
futurist
clif
oslo.x

removing requirements that are breaking old
branches and are no longer used directly.
openstacksdk requires futurist but only
on centos8 py3

Closes-Bug: #1869161
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715324/
Change-Id: I224b950bf33d365c83ecac68c2b9a0092bb969bb

commit_message:
Fix condition tuned profile.

Fix the warning evaluating as a bare variable, this behaviour will go
away and you might need to add |bool to the expression in the future.

Change-Id: I588e24f0b0e574b9ecea9f3b8d932a94b116a4d5

 > need an upgrade path from Rocky to Stein. This may well happen as

commit_message:
Stein fixes

- Switch to Stein release
- Cookstyle fixes
- Update cookbook etcd to ~> 5.6
- Update README
- Add myself to author list and OSU Copyright
- Properly fix completions recipe and ensure it works
- Create and start the etcd service in the etcd recipe
- Update delivery configuration to exclude integration cookbooks
- Refactor and update RenderConfigFileMatcher to work with newer
  ChefSpec. This fixes output which was passing but showing error
  messages.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701027
Change-Id: Iba3eeabe85ab9303147e43eeb550212a46d190f3

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2020-01-08 00:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

This can't be merged until we upgrade all relevant cookbooks to the newer apache2 cookbook which converts all of the definitions to resources. The newer ChefDK/Workstation includes a newer ChefSpec which removes support for definitions and thus creates an error for tests. Such as the following:

```
1) openstack-identity::server-apache ubuntu does not run logging recipe
Failure/Error: runner.converge(described_recipe)

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `params' for nil:NilClass
# /tmp/d20200108-110-uv2kcr/cookbooks/openstack-identity/recipes/server-apache.rb:113:in `from_file'
# ./spec/server-apache_spec.rb:11:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
# ./spec/server-apache_spec.rb:36:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
```

I'll start working on getting that done in the various cookbooks that depend on apache2."}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2020-01-31 00:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2020-01-31 16:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2020-02-05 19:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2020-02-05 21:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-02-06 09:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Start Stein development

- Update references from Rocky to Stein.
- Switch to using chef-workstation
- Exclude integration group from Berksfile. This is to ensure ChefSpec tests
  should always work regardless if we're working on integration related
  cookbooks that don't interact with those tests.
- Temporarily disable voting for integration tests due to cookbook version
  conflicts
- Add tests for openstack-common::etcd and openstack-common::completions
- Update tests for Stein
- Update OVS port to check
- Add tests for lbaas but only for kitchen, not for CI pipeline
- Add suite and tests for integration-test

Change-Id: Id451b08e361acc709879a65d0d92b35640a5dba9

commit_message:
mech_driver.OVNMechanismDriver "_ovn_client" is a read-only property

mech_driver.OVNMechanismDriver "_ovn_client" is not a class member but
a read-only property and can't be assigned.

Closes-Bug: #1869342

Don't rotate passwords when updating plan

If the passwods exist we should not update those when updating
plan.

Closes-Bug: #1869010

[{'created': '2020-03-26 15:17:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use doc-only requirements

Doc requirements are not needed for unit test runs. This moves doc
requirements into the recommended doc/requirements.txt location and
updates the tox target to pull from there.

Change-Id: I06761a6090d64ae1be5065727f7f56ede14c8d13

commit_message:
Use doc-only requirements

Doc requirements are not needed for unit test runs. This moves doc
requirements into the recommended doc/requirements.txt location and
updates the tox target to pull from there.

Change-Id: I06761a6090d64ae1be5065727f7f56ede14c8d13
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop Python 3.5 jobs

The openstackdocstheme no longer supports Python 3.5 and we are
already testing with Python 3.6.

Change-Id: I18c4a9a07d5440867b8f722858194d2f9e1b6b66

commit_message:
If only .pyc exist, the extension API will be disabled

In some commercial production environments, generally will not expose the
source code, this means that only .pyc files exist in the environment.In
this case, the extension API cannot be loaded.

Closes-Bug:#1869148
Change-Id: Id5238e7efe5ff0b80197ac0afa9f5f7a73239f20
(cherry picked from commit 8c582d87912270afa37371bbb202ae98dc1d375c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 11:29:35.000000000', 'message': 'Filter subnets on fixed_ips segment

For v6_stateless IP addresses for all stateless
subnets within a network are implicitly included.

When using segments implicitly allocating addresses
across subnets on different segments is incorrect.
IPs from subnets on differnt segments was allocated
when no host binding information was available
but a subnet_id in fixed_ips request was present.

This change adds filtering based on segment_id when
fixed_ips are used. If fixed_ips are not all on the
same segment exception FixedIpsSubnetsNotOnSameSegment
is raised.

Related: rhbz#1803989
Related-Bug: #1864333
Related-Bug: #1865138
Closes-Bug: #1864225
Change-Id: I336ae76283f29dd226344fb454aaa0e4aac030ea
(cherry picked from commit 7e09e72661b0b3a0f898c20d451e204aa7a17194)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter subnets on fixed_ips segment

For v6_stateless IP addresses for all stateless
subnets within a network are implicitly included.

When using segments implicitly allocating addresses
across subnets on different segments is incorrect.
IPs from subnets on differnt segments was allocated
when no host binding information was available
but a subnet_id in fixed_ips request was present.

This change adds filtering based on segment_id when
fixed_ips are used. If fixed_ips are not all on the
same segment exception FixedIpsSubnetsNotOnSameSegment
is raised.

Related: rhbz#1803989
Related-Bug: #1864333
Related-Bug: #1865138
Closes-Bug: #1864225
Change-Id: I336ae76283f29dd226344fb454aaa0e4aac030ea
(cherry picked from commit 7e09e72661b0b3a0f898c20d451e204aa7a17194)

commit_message:
Add Pygments to upper-constraints

Pygments is already in global-requirements, but not in
upper-constraints. Pygments is required by Sphinx.

Pygments removed support for py2 in version 2.6.0 so we
need to ensure that it is properly pinned to prevent
tests/docs failing.

Pygments was added to the blacklist in
I643c7632a02c87820c9c51f03fa34f0764384783 but it's not
entirely clear why. To ensure that it is managed in
upper-constraints from now on, we remove it from the
blacklist.

Change-Id: I18a50482e588176047ede81c4ee994c9d7df282b
Closes-Bug: #1869174

commit_message:
Deny delete last slaac subnet with allocation on segment

When a port has only one IP allocation on auto-allocation
subnet which is associated with a segment, do not allow
the delete of the subnet. Raise SubnetInUse exception instead.

Related: rhbz#1803989
Related-Bug: #1864225
Related-Bug: #1864333
Closes-Bug: #1865138
Change-Id: I9fb0f05ede42afa1a349635b1936028edf540a1f
(cherry picked from commit f987486febb9fbe88232bb9139508981b92147f1)

commit_message:
subnet create - segment aware auto-addr allocation

When creating additional subnets with ipv6 auto-addressing
ip allocation was added to existing ports without filtering
on current allocation's segment.

This adds fitering to only add auto-address allocation when
the new subnet is on the same segment as the ports current
ipam allocations.

Related: rhbz#1803989
Related-Bug: #1864225
Related-Bug: #1865138
Closes-Bug: #1864333
Change-Id: I75ae14c64db076434ca9897ba9a6d97702e233ad
(cherry picked from commit 3d3dc60408148cf16bc19cccb76b8652f980fa1c)

commit_message:
Wait for ironic-neutron-agent bridge_mappings before provide

When provide is immediately run after import, it sometimes stalls
indefinitely due to port creation failure.

This fix avoids this issue by polling the ironic neutron agent
associated with the host until:
1. the agent entry exists for that host
2. the agent configuration has something populated for bridge_mappings

Change-Id: I7eb90fb0b532942825e32c43ebd057a28005c8ec
Closes-Bug: #1866204

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 08:27:01.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when truncating the jobs file for sync

Truncating the watched path file inside of the trigger sync script
launches the path trigger again. It tries to acquire a lock then, while
there is no jobs expected though for such a case. In order to avoid
this situation, exit immediately, when the jobs file is empty or
missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger for
acquiring a lock to a 10 seconds. Then fail it, if the lock cannot be
acquired. This also prevents other possible deadlock scenarios.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 08:28:23.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when truncating the jobs file for sync

Truncating the watched path file inside of the trigger sync script
launches the path trigger again. It tries to acquire a lock then, while
there is no jobs expected though for such a case. In order to avoid
this situation, exit immediately, when the jobs file is empty or
missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger for
acquiring a lock to a 10 seconds. Then fail it, if the lock cannot be
acquired. This also prevents other possible deadlock scenarios.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 08:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race with locks for the sync/wrapper script

Exit immediately and omit locking itself, when the jobs file is empty
or missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger and
the service wrapper scripts, when acquiring a lock. Then fail it, if
the lock cannot be acquired after a 10 seconds. This prevents other
possible racy scenarios, like dealocks.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Do not race with locks for the sync/wrapper script

Exit immediately and omit locking itself, when the jobs file is empty
or missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger and
the service wrapper scripts, when acquiring a lock. Then fail it, if
the lock cannot be acquired after a 10 seconds. This prevents other
possible racy scenarios, like dealocks.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support for mariadb's ed25519 authentication

Add the ability to configure all mysql users to require authenticating
to the server via mariadb's ed25519 auth plugin [1], rather than the
default native authentication [2].

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/authentication-plugin-ed25519/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/authentication-plugin-mysql_native_password/

Change-Id: I430ea8e1fa15fb263d1d4ef8c39615021d907f8a
Partial-Bug: #1866093

commit_message:
Add unit test job on CentOS8

This patch introduces a unit test job which runs on CentOS8, so that we
can migrate from CentOS7 and CentOS8.
The new unit test job on CentOS8 is added as non-voting job initially,
but will be make as voting job with removing CentOS7 one after we
confirm the gate status of master and stable branches after this change
is merged.

Change-Id: Iee33fe1953af27b5f4b68b093464a831cb4ddcc6

commit_message:
DCN/Edge: Handle ipv6 address for local glance endpoint

In a DCN/Edge deployment, the glance endpoint is overridden so that
nova and cinder use the local glance-api service. When the deployment
is using ipv6, ensure the endpoint URI has brackets around the ipv6
address.

Closes-Bug: #1868579
Change-Id: I8e71a1f6df732c352b018472c30c662f1e726aaa
(cherry picked from commit 95b01718045d8c26f259ac91c7dba5cae3fd1447)
Conflicts:
	deployment/haproxy/haproxy-edge-container-puppet.yaml

[{'created': '2020-03-26 14:35:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use multipath in nova when multipathd is enabled

Currently we have environments/multipathd.yaml to deploy multipathd
service, but we still need to set NovaLibvirtVolumeUseMultipath to
make instances use multipath for volume connections.

This patch makes the environment file to also enable multipath usage

'}]
commit_message:
Use multipath in nova when multipathd is enabled

Currently we have environments/multipathd.yaml to deploy multipathd
service, but we still need to set NovaLibvirtVolumeUseMultipath to
make instances use multipath for volume connections.

This patch makes the environment file to also enable multipath usage
in nova, as we expect that user who use the environment want to
use multipath for volume connections.

Change-Id: I3ca55c01c4b03e990470c55b835095a71f3cad62

commit_message:
Create a pre-deploy-plan playbook

This playbook will execute the deployment validataions and run a cellsv2
discovery which is required before a deployment is started.

Change-Id: I757a12a00f251e73d27cceecc014f03a6fc96bb2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-02 22:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-03-03 19:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

We need to fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710474 first. It is causing our CI failures here. Refer to this error message http://paste.openstack.org/show/790275/ from https://8d607284f65de3fd9779-02d4d51f19d44277cadc3f0a0159460a.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/710479/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode/6e6997c/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log and https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_677/710479/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates/677d713/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-04 20:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-03-05 19:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-05 23:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-05 23:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from task/38967 to mistral_to_ansible'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-06 02:59:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I had the impression that we would move the workflows that are complex ones (more than 2/3 tasks) to ansible rather than bloating the python-tripleoclient code. As is tripleoclient code is unmanageable atm. It seems that plan has changed as we're building all those complex workflows in python."}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-03-06 13:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Rabi, we're trying to re-use as much existing code as possible. Consider this "phase 1" of moving away from Mistral and Zaqar. "Phase 2" will involve  more proper conversions to Ansible content where it makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2020-03-06 13:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-06 14:19:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> I had the impression that we would move the workflows that are
 > complex ones (more than 2/3 tasks) to ansible rather than bloating
 > the python-tripleoclient code. As is tripleoclient code is
 > unmanageable atm. It seems that plan has changed as we're building
 > all those complex workflows in python.

The hope is to convert this, and others functions, to an ansible playbook, but our first order of business is to remove our use of mistral and zaqar. Once mistral is no longer a factor in deployment we'll be taking a look at converting these tasks into playbooks and moving the code to V2."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-06 14:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> I had the impression that we would move the workflows that are
 > complex ones (more than 2/3 tasks) to ansible rather than bloating
 > the python-tripleoclient code. As is tripleoclient code is
 > unmanageable atm. It seems that plan has changed as we're building
 > all those complex workflows in python.

For more on our plan of action you can have a look at our storyboard here - https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/board/208"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-06 23:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-03-13 11:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-15 08:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-03-16 01:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:56:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-27 15:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Remove the mistral from the deploy_plan workflow

This change removes all of mistral from the deploy_plan
function by calling the required functions directly.

commit_message:
Enable start/stop of instances with accelerators.

. Do not delete accelerator requests in stop code paths.
. In the start code path, get the list of accelerator requests from
  Cyborg in the compute manager 'power_on'.
. Pass accel_info (said list) to the virt driver power_on.
. In libvirt driver, pass that accel_info to driver power_on.

Change-Id: I8c94504b87aa4450d163fe2b33f6aa0eb5dae5ff
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-05 00:14:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update compute os-deferred_delete tests to adopt new policies

Nova is moving to new policy defaults in ussuri[1] where
few polciies are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

With granularity in few policies make change in policy name so
we have update the patrole tests to start checking against the
new policy names from ussuri onwards.

This commit updates the os-deferred_delete tests to move to new policies
from ussuri onwards.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707485/

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html

Change-Id: I399e9e2bf944cfbba4b47f05ba2f529cbc1b9ea1
'}, {'created': '2020-03-06 00:52:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update compute os-deferred_delete tests to adopt new policies

we have update the patrole tests to start checking against the
new policy names from ussuri onwards.

This commit updates the os-deferred_delete tests to move to new policies
from ussuri onwards.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html

commit_message:
Update compute tests to adopt new policies

Nova is moving to new policy defaults in ussuri[1] where
few polciies are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

With granularity in few policies make change in policy name so
we have update the patrole tests to start checking against the
new policy names from ussuri onwards.

This commit updates the os-deferred_delete and os-attach-interfaces
tests to move to new policies from ussuri onwards.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html

Change-Id: I399e9e2bf944cfbba4b47f05ba2f529cbc1b9ea1

commit_message:
Fix TESTING.rst example

There is no api.v1 functional test directory, just api.v2.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I1b1a77fc671194524250db6c2ec9e89505ef602b

commit_message:
Replace CBS mash repositories for mimic by mirror in RDO

CBS mash repositories are being removed by CentOS team [1]. Actually it
was never a good practice to consume them directly although in some
cases was needed because of issus publishing packages.

[1] https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2020-March/036679.html

Change-Id: I42fde8356757f0a100a549072834bc97dd0768bf
(cherry picked from commit 6da1dd3f17a0ad6bb1a356706eccb302aad91f06)
(cherry picked from commit 3ded6008732985ace44e739b248367acc1abc8ca)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

this removes some cruft that can be removed now:
* cruft in setup.cfg and setup.py
* tox.ini: Add ignore_basepython_conflict and increase minversion
  for that
* Python 2/3 specific requirements, the repo is Python 3 only.

Change-Id: Iae68e58c82a180eb771bef00a3f44fd28abe5fae

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin SbÃ¢rnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll ð¥'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 08:40:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to not delete artifacts in IR plugin

Adds user facing option, which when enabled
will skip deletion of collected artifacts at
the end of infrared plugin.

Also it should never attempt deleting the working_dir,
as usually that is managed outside of artcl (virtualenv
created by tox or such), if then it should be wiping only collect_dir.

This is needed for:
- molecule based verification
- for any post-processing/detection of known issues in CI
- or when used locally without publishing for user to access them.

Extracted from change If14fd9130ddb07469cb12fbc0b72f16884b55949.

Change-Id: I4e8123c8f112dfc5c85c1ac80f04191e57147c97
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to not delete artifacts in IR plugin

Adds user facing option, which when enabled
will skip deletion of collected artifacts at
the end of infrared plugin.

Also it should never attempt deleting the working_dir,
as usually that is managed outside of artcl (virtualenv
created by tox or such), if then it should be wiping only collect_dir.

This is needed for:
- molecule based verification
- for any post-processing/detection of known issues in CI
- or when used locally without publishing for user to access them.

Extracted from change If14fd9130ddb07469cb12fbc0b72f16884b55949.

Change-Id: I4e8123c8f112dfc5c85c1ac80f04191e57147c97

commit_message:
tripleo-validations failing on lower constraints

python-openstackclient requires:
- keystoneauth1>=3.14.0
- openstacksdk>=0.36.0

but openstacksdk requires:
- os-service-types>=1.7.0
- keystoneauth1>=3.16.0

Change-Id: Ic76cad76ebdd7cc9adf64866a4fd2ed16477166a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 16:17:47.000000000', 'message': 'Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158

commit_message:
Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158

commit_message:
Remove CephAnsibleSkipTags override

We want to skip tags for installing packages as is the default.
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_common/defaults/main.yml#L64

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714768/

Closes-Bug: #1868731

Change-Id: I85af342e3a546e1c195c7ba3d39d53e85e6fdd7e
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix join of status_reason

At present, the status reason resolves to:

    default-master <reason> ,default-worker <reason>

It should be:

    default-master <reason>, default-worker <reason>

This minor patch fixes this.

Task: 39092
Story: 2007438

Change-Id: I3382da8d950279713861e14d97997d5a5205b1e7
(cherry picked from commit dfea2741f2de6fb1e92b177aa230b59987bc575d)

commit_message:
Use rally-openstack 1.7.0 for stable/train

Master branch now has requirements incompatible with stable branches
constraints [0], so this switches to last tag compatible.

Longer term fix will be to run rally in a virtualenv, but this is lower
priority than other tasks. This can be revisited at the time, though for
older branches we will probably stick with pinned version

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack/commit/5776e015f16321fdb489ebb482d984ccd3cd2903

Change-Id: Iba1da7b4214d98bc1500ea57ed1faade423adf31
Closes-Bug: #1868691

commit_message:
Set --bindir when installing bundle

... because recent gem ignores $GEM_HOME to decide the place to which
it install bin files, and we need to set it explicity to have bundle
command installed in $GEM_HOME/bin.

Change-Id: I3a381d43429fbf2b7ae6d90ff7a2bc3018b4a41d
Related-bug: #1866176

subject: Add python-stow-versions element
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28619, 'name': 'Dmitriy Rabotyagov', 'email': 'noonedeadpunk@gmail.com', 'username': 'noonedeadpunk'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-18 16:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-18 17:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This looks great.

A couple of thoughts:

First - as mentioned inline - it would fit in better with other elements to  call the -dev packages something-dev in the pacakge-installs.yaml file... that way you can also install the non-dev libs too.

Second - it would be great to also clean up the -dev packages and the make utility and gcc and stuff when we're done here. I'm not 100% sure package-installs will let you both install and uinstall the same package -so it might need to be a second element like "cleanup-ensure-python" with only package-install.yaml and pkg-map with the dev stuff marked as uninstall.

That seems lame - so it's also possible that maybe just improving package-installs is a thing we shoudl do - but that's really just all future optimization.

I think the package naming is the only thing we should change for this patch.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-18 20:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-18 20:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-03-18 22:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

i'll presume you have a pretty good reason for wanting to do this in dib?

is it tested?  how long does it take?  should we add it to ... something ... in our gate?  i think we probably already have too many jobs, but if it fits somewhere with other testing.

I'm ok with the code, but I really think we should choose another name.  with all our work stripping images back i can see we might want a system python installer.  we've already got "ensure-venv" (which pulls in python implicitly) so I think we want to keep the "ensure-" name-space as very vanilla, default things like system packages; which this isn't.

so if we could rename it something more like what it's doing ("prebuild-python-stow" or "stow-python-versions" or something?)'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 13:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> i'll presume you have a pretty good reason for wanting to do this
 > in dib?
 
I thought this can be good optimization to what py version is going to be used in zuul jobs, and pyenv role introduced here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704266/

 > is it tested?  how long does it take?  should we add it to ...
 > something ... in our gate?  i think we probably already have too
 > many jobs, but if it fits somewhere with other testing.
 
So regarding timing, here's some profiling output http://paste.openstack.org/show/790890/ But it's going to save time in day-to day running zuul jobs.
Yes, I was thinking about adding it to the nodepool builder, but not sure how to do that at the moment tbh.

 > I'm ok with the code, but I really think we should choose another
 > name.  with all our work stripping images back i can see we might
 > want a system python installer.  we've already got "ensure-venv"
 > (which pulls in python implicitly) so I think we want to keep the
 > "ensure-" name-space as very vanilla, default things like system
 > packages; which this isn't.
 > 
 > so if we could rename it something more like what it's doing
 > ("prebuild-python-stow" or "stow-python-versions" or something?)

Yeah, ok, I'll rename it - just took the same name as for zuul role.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-19 14:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> i'll presume you have a pretty good reason for wanting to do this
 > in dib?
 
The driving use case here is actually Vexxhost's Zuul. They want to be able to build images that have all the pythons installed and then use ensure-python in zuul-jobs to make sure the right one is symlinked in to place. I don't expect opendev to use this role.

 > is it tested?  how long does it take?  should we add it to ...
 > something ... in our gate?  i think we probably already have too
 > many jobs, but if it fits somewhere with other testing.
 

The pyenv install itself isn't too bad timewise - but I think that's not too much of an issue.

I do think figuring out the _right_ way to test this would be good - but I'm not 100% sure what that is.

 > I'm ok with the code, but I really think we should choose another
 > name.  with all our work stripping images back i can see we might
 > want a system python installer.  we've already got "ensure-venv"
 > (which pulls in python implicitly) so I think we want to keep the
 > "ensure-" name-space as very vanilla, default things like system
 > packages; which this isn't.
 > 
 > so if we could rename it something more like what it's doing
 > ("prebuild-python-stow" or "stow-python-versions" or something?)

I think I like stow-python-versions.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 16:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 18:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 18:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-19 18:59:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)

I have a new trick to show you!

There's an element called source-respositories that will let you express that you need a git repo - and it'll clone it outside of the target root in a cache location then copy it in."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 19:18:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-19 19:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-03-25 23:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-26 20:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-26 22:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-03-27 11:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Add python-stow-versions element

This element is designed to install latest minor versions of different
python releases, like py27, py35, py36, py37, py38
into stow directory, and later easily enable them with stow.

Change-Id: Iab6d20e7643e549b53c629fb430e58b1c5e72991

commit_message:
Update event table to work with simulateneous events

This updates the table status logic to handle multiple Current or Next
events. It also simplifies some of that detection logic and handles
multiple items in the countdown timer.

Change-Id: Iff85bb59d4d9a472b56b552f663709f7364b992a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Deploy feature027 with camelcased hostname

To avoid future regressions when the hostname is camelcased, let's have
at least one job where the undercloud.conf has the hostname configured
with -Unique suffix.

Change-Id: I5b842a46a582e21b50da310e693032f02b891c94
Related-Bug: #1869360

Please wait for this change to merge, and then cherry-pick into Train. You will then get an annotation on your commit message that the Train patch was cherrypicked from commit 8c582d87912270afa37371bbb202ae98dc1d375c. This is our usual convention - we don't merge bugfix backports to earlier stable branches  before the later branches.. 


For example, if you want to fix a bug that affects manila since Queens, you would:

- Create the change on master. Allow it to merge
- Cherry-pick the change from master to Train. Allow it to merge.
- Cherry-pick the Train change to Stein. Allow it to merge
- Cherry-Pick the Stein change to Rocky. Allow it to merge
- Cherry-pick the Rocky change to Queens."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-03-27 10:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-03-27 10:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
If only .pyc exist, the extension API will be disabled

In some commercial production environments, generally will not expose the
source code, this means that only .pyc files exist in the environment.In
this case, the extension API cannot be loaded.

Closes-Bug:#1869148
Change-Id: Id5238e7efe5ff0b80197ac0afa9f5f7a73239f20

'}, {'created': '2019-10-14 06:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Delete ARQs for an instance when the instance is deleted.

This works for regular VM termination, soft reboots, pause/unpause
and VM-agnostic operations like lock/unlock.

Does not work for stop, rescue (with same image) and shelve:
ARQs don't get deleted. Suspend gives a generic error from
libvirt that the domain has assigned non-USB devices (unrelated
to this patch).

Change-Id: Icb95890d8f16cad1f7dc18487a48def2f7c9aec2
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction
"}, {'created': '2019-10-30 02:41:40.000000000', 'message': 'Delete ARQs for an instance when the instance is deleted.

This patch series now works for most VM operations:
* Creation, deletion of VM instances.
* Reboots: soft, hard, within VM.
* Pause/unpause
* Stop/start
* Rescue with same image
* Rebuild with same image

The following work but are no-ops:
* Lock/unlock
* Resize with same flavor

Suspend gives a generic error unrelated to this patch:
   libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid:
   domain has assigned non-USB host devices

Shelve is not supported. Live migration is not intended to be supported.

Change-Id: Icb95890d8f16cad1f7dc18487a48def2f7c9aec2
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

This patch series now works for many VM operations with libvirt:
* Creation, deletion of VM instances.
* Pause/unpause

The following work but are no-ops:
* Lock/unlock
* Resize with same flavor

Hard reboots are taken up in a later patch in this series.
Soft reboots work for accelerators unless some unrelated failure
forces a hard reboot in the libvirt driver.

Suspend gives a generic error unrelated to this patch:
   libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid:
   domain has assigned non-USB host devices

Shelve is not supported yet.
Live migration is not intended to be supported with accelerators now.

commit_message:
Delete ARQs for an instance when the instance is deleted.

This patch series now works for many VM operations with libvirt:
* Creation, deletion of VM instances.
* Pause/unpause

The following works but is a no-op:
* Lock/unlock

Hard reboots are taken up in a later patch in this series.
Soft reboots work for accelerators unless some unrelated failure
forces a hard reboot in the libvirt driver.

Suspend is not supported yet. It would fail with this error:
   libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid:
   domain has assigned non-USB host devices

Shelve is not supported yet.
Live migration is not intended to be supported with accelerators now.

Change-Id: Icb95890d8f16cad1f7dc18487a48def2f7c9aec2
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

commit_message:
Run pip check at end of devstack

The new pip depsolver is coming this summer. Until it's ready,
run pip check at the end of devstack to make sure we're not
somehow installing conflicting package versions. We shouldn't
be, because of constraints, but if we are, better to know and
start figuring it out.

Change-Id: Id98f0848ff5a252d93e5f8029df2d069924d603f

commit_message:
Add component_promotion as a featureset_override

To avoid adding multiple component release files,
add a variable to allow the component to be
specified in each job.

Change-Id: I390f4458de6a40117be20a461ce74b86a7cce0a5
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1408

commit_message:
Create default network for compute volume and negative metadata tests

server metadata and volume tests also create server without passing
the network to nova which further fail if more than one test network exists.

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-qa/%23openstack-qa.2020-03-03.log.html#t2020-03-03T15:57:34

Partial-Bug: #1844568
Change-Id: I9956946a4309b9a013fd53b0db06718372a9213c

commit_message:
Fix behavior for Show command to stick to tripleoclient

The behavior of the Show command wasn't exactly as tripleoclient
This review aims to fix it

Change-Id: I4e1af84675bfe722e232217f15c29fbc3d006333

commit_message:
Fix calico regression issue caused by default ipv4pool change

With I13aa0c58bf168bc069edf1d5c0187f89011fffdb, we missed to update
the default value of pods_network_cidr. As a result, there is a
mismatch between the calico_ipv4pool and the cidr configured in
kubernetes (kube-proxy and kube-controller-mananer). The mismatch
will cause some connection issues between pods/nodes. This patch
fixes it.

Task: 39153
Story: 2007426

commit_message:
Include cache class where needed for memcached

ensure cache class is added to allow related change[1]
to enable caching of authtokens in memcached.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634505/

Change-Id: I4f204cf6622ae11c800cd66e88e905a58d7fdd4e

* pep8 execution failed on pylint phase with some astroid traceback for
  RuntimeError: generator raised StopIteration.
  The issue can be solved by setting both pylint and astroid versions.
  The new pylint causes some new checks, like inheriting from object which
  in py3 is not necessary again to write out.

* Fix some db shcema mismatches between migration scripts and model.

* Bump the lower bound of pyScss which is a dependency of horizon
  to 1.3.7 to make it work with setuptools 46. This just follows
  horizon change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/.

Change-Id: I4119f6455e7af83cf397dec531b0a11f88112f21
'}]
commit_message:
Fix recent gate failures

* pep8 execution failed on pylint phase with some astroid traceback for
  RuntimeError: generator raised StopIteration.
  The issue can be solved by setting both pylint and astroid versions.
  The new pylint causes some new checks, like inheriting from object which
  in py3 is not necessary again to write out.

* Fix some db shcema mismatches between migration scripts and model.

* Bump the lower bound of pyScss which is a dependency of horizon
  to 1.3.7 to make it work with setuptools 46. This just follows
  horizon change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/.

Change-Id: I4119f6455e7af83cf397dec531b0a11f88112f21

commit_message:
Adding options to user cli

User options [1] can be set by making POST and PATCH
request for /v3/users API calls but cannot by openstack
CLI because of no user options defined in create and update
user CLI [2]. This patch adds the user options [1] in
create user and update user CLI.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/resource-options.html#multi-factor-auth-rules
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/#create-user

Change-Id: I4e41bae2e8cfbe92d52b14d856991bedcd44164f

commit_message:
[metadata agent] Account for 'external' ports

With the introduction of OVN 'external' ports, there can be
VIF ports that live in an external chassis. These should be
able to reach the metadata service so if an 'external' port
is bound to a hypervisor, metadata service will be provisioned
for it.

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib1c1eca68630f08de44aec29b6f6edac5e554f16
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
k8s: Fix logic of when a cluster API is accessible

At present, if floating_ip_enabled is true and master_lb_enabled is also
true but master_lb_fip_enabled is false, a cluster still resolves to
being accessible therefore resolves to an UNHEALTHY status when it
should be UNKNOWN. This patch fixes this edge case and also adds a unit
test to capture this issue.

Story: 2007242
Task: 39140

Change-Id: I74f7455e3caa920032080747a315470878ba5500

commit_message:
Replace CBS mash repositories for mimic by mirror in RDO

CBS mash repositories are being removed by CentOS team [1]. Actually it
was never a good practice to consume them directly although in some
cases was needed because of issus publishing packages.

[1] https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2020-March/036679.html

Change-Id: I42fde8356757f0a100a549072834bc97dd0768bf
(cherry picked from commit 6da1dd3f17a0ad6bb1a356706eccb302aad91f06)

commit_message:
Cleanup SoftwareConfigTransport

Since this is nwo set to POLL_SERVER_HEAT by default in the
overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml, we no longer need to
override it for the undercloud/standalone use case.

See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671980/

Change-Id: I3e2cfd856bf46fb82998e8f14c64b11299862238

subject: Disable notification from services by default
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 11:02:22.000000000', 'message': "Disable notification from services by default

Currently we disable Telemetry services like Ceilometer by defaut,
which means that we don't have any consumers for notification messages.
So NotificationDriver should be set as noop by default so that we don't
have unconsumed messages in notification queues.

Change-Id: I7aa7d8768b0d7571cdba9a3c3ac85a5e52e00c71
"}]
commit_message:
Disable notification from services by default

Currently we disable Telemetry services like Ceilometer by defaut,
which means that we don't have any consumers for notification messages.
So NotificationDriver should be set as noop by default so that we don't
have unconsumed messages in notification queues.

Change-Id: I7aa7d8768b0d7571cdba9a3c3ac85a5e52e00c71

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove unused parameters

We only care about neutron security groups now, so a lot of nova-network
only cruft can be removed. Do just that.

Change-Id: I2a360e766261a186f9edf6ceb47a786aea2957eb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-26 02:10:17.000000000', 'message': "mariadb container name variable

mariadb container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, mariadb container_name variable
is variable. If the mariadb container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to container_name,
but a fixed 'mariadb' name.

Change-Id: Ie8efa509953d5efa5c3073c9b550be051a7f4f9b
(cherry picked from commit 8a206699d4d2e550963a7b7be38fc8281075133c)
"}]
commit_message:
mariadb container name variable

mariadb container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, mariadb container_name variable
is variable. If the mariadb container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to container_name,
but a fixed 'mariadb' name.

Change-Id: Ie8efa509953d5efa5c3073c9b550be051a7f4f9b
(cherry picked from commit 8a206699d4d2e550963a7b7be38fc8281075133c)

cases was needed because of issus publishing packages.

commit_message:
keystone roles container name variable

keystone and keystone_fernet container name variable is fixed
in some places, but in the defaults directory, keystone
and keystone_fernet container_name variable is variable.
If the keystone and keystone_fernet container_name variable is
changed during deployment, it will not be assigned to keystone
and keystone_fernet, but a fixed 'keystone' and 'keystone_fernet' name.

Change-Id: Ifc8ac69e6abc4586f0e4fd820b9022aea9f76396

commit_message:
Update setuptools in virtualenv

virtualenv is bundled with setuptools-46.1.1 but
that has a bug[1] which ignores executable permission
on installed files which is fixed in 46.1.3 with [1],
until new virtualenv is released with good version of
setuptools bundled and is available in nodepool image
temporary update setuptools in venv.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1752
[2] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/7e2f3074

Related-Bug: #1869119
Change-Id: Ia3fbd8116d8de1951d9a1261bf07a1f5ba9cc8a2

[{'created': '2019-07-22 08:09:58.000000000', 'message': "Stop using swift temp url for config transport

We now download the software configs and push them to the nodes
using ansible. So there is no point of using swift temp url any more.
Though we don't use occ, it's better to set it to POLL_SERVER_HEAT
rather than the default POLL_SERVER_CFN which has a dependency on
heat-api-cfn.

Change-Id: Id7ea0c30c60e07f366e1a211a83e135b9735161f
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using swift temp url for config transport

We now download the software configs and push them to the nodes
using ansible. So there is no point of using swift temp url any more.
Though we don't use occ, it's better to set it to POLL_SERVER_HEAT
rather than the default POLL_SERVER_CFN which has a dependency on
heat-api-cfn.

Change-Id: Id7ea0c30c60e07f366e1a211a83e135b9735161f

commit_message:
Add decompression import plugin

Supported compression formats initially are:
* zip
* gzip
* lha/lzh _if_ lhafile is installed

Change-Id: Id125ebb5e8a9b22a8797d3158e60451d80bfaa14

commit_message:
Compose accelerator PCI devices into domain XML in libvirt driver.

Each accelerator request in the accel_info list has an attach handle,
which in turn contains a PCI BDF for passthrough. They get composed
as hostdev devices into the VM's domain XML.

Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction
Change-Id: I08cd4787ab4c9539574237e26ba5bf6d4246b32e

  when connecting to S3
* Support multiple store configuration
* Support secure hash algorithm
* Delete proxy option that used when connecting to
  S3

'}, {'created': '2020-03-08 09:49:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add S3 store support to glance_store

Revive the S3 driver that was supported up to Mitaka and add multiple
store support to correspond with the features added to glance_store from
Newton to U cycle. In addition, the use of the S3 SDK used by the Mitaka
S3 driver has been deprecated, so this implementation will be changed
to use the new version.

Change-Id: I203134837319080ead96da69048baf90086d2117
Implements: blueprint bp/re-support-s3-driver

'}]
commit_message:
Add S3 store support to glance_store

Revive the S3 driver that was supported up to Mitaka and add multiple
store support to correspond with the features added to glance_store from
Newton to U cycle. In addition, the use of the S3 SDK used by the Mitaka
S3 driver has been deprecated, so this implementation will be changed
to use the new version.

Change-Id: I203134837319080ead96da69048baf90086d2117
Implements: blueprint re-support-s3-driver

commit_message:
Make cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest job voting

The job has been stable for a while now, so make it a voting job
again.  This change was discussed at the weekly Cinder meeting
on 11 March 2020.

Change-Id: I29382fdc7c72799e96391dd20d499b65c1bdb8f5

> I'm a bit concerned about changing Cinder to try to avoid a
 > segfault elsewhere -- can you provide more info in the bug about
 > the crash?

Close the image then call the unprotect_snap function. Segmentation fault will arise. https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1794956/comments/6"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This needs to be fixed in librbd.'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:43:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Well, yeah, librdb should handle this more gracefully, but regardless, we're doing it wrong. Attempting to perform any operations on a volume that has been closed will result in one of three things (in order of best to worst):
1. Nothing whatsoever. A no-op. This will be the case once it's addressed in librbd.
2. It'll segfault. That'll can happen to anyone using a non-fixed librbd.
3. Something entirely unpredictable. This can also happen to anyone using a non-fixed librbd if they're unlucky enough that the given ImageContext inside of librbd has been replaced with something else after our call to .close() freed it.

There's literally nothing to lose by fixing this and lots to gain.

Hard +1."}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:55:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Well, yeah, librdb should handle this more gracefully, but
 > regardless, we're doing it wrong. Attempting to perform any
 > operations on a volume that has been closed will result in one of
 > three things (in order of best to worst):
 > 1. Nothing whatsoever. A no-op. This will be the case once it's
 > addressed in librbd.
 > 2. It'll segfault. That'll can happen to anyone using a non-fixed
 > librbd.
 > 3. Something entirely unpredictable. This can also happen to anyone
 > using a non-fixed librbd if they're unlucky enough that the given
 > ImageContext inside of librbd has been replaced with something else
 > after our call to .close() freed it.
 > 
 > There's literally nothing to lose by fixing this and lots to gain.
 > 
 > Hard +1.

Wow, thanks for your detailed explanation."}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2020-03-04 10:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Wow, thanks for your detailed explanation.

I'm having trouble following this patch.  If the problem is that we're calling unprotect_snap() on an already closed volume, then maybe we should explicitly check for that situation before calling it instead of trying to rearrange the .close() calls so this doesn't happen?  I think you may need some comments in the code to indicate what's going on, because otherwise someone will come along and refactor this to make it "better" and we'll get a regression.'}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2020-03-09 20:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-09-28 11:26:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug of cloning volume

Remove the 'src_volume.close()'. If closing the src_volume, the src_volume
will fail to call the unprotect_snap function when the depth is larger than
rbd_max_clone_depth.

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
"}, {'created': '2020-03-04 09:54:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug of cloning volume

"}, {'created': '2020-03-12 01:45:35.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where an exception during
flattening would attempt to unprotect and remove the source volume
snapshot after the source volume had already been closed.  This logic
results in a segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956

commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956

(19 comments)

There really is a lot going on with this patch. It really would be better to just get the driver restored as supported first, then have one (or probably multiple) patches updating it after that for all of the other changes that are included in this patch.'}, {'account_id': 31064, 'date': '2020-02-09 01:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(8 comments)

General comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-09 15:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)

Code merged to ussuri is only for ussuri. Several things need to be cleaned up here to be acceptable to be merged. Please address those comments.

The OpenStack upstream community is not for marketing. If you want a driver that handles all things for all releases and do not want to follow upstream development and feedback, then remove the driver and just provide it directly to your users via your GitHub repo. Otherwise, address comments and get this in shape for the current development cycle and we will be happy to include it.'}, {'account_id': 31064, 'date': '2020-02-10 19:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Our company put a lot of effort in doing "the right thing" - upstream the cinder driver properly, run CI, etc.. The reason our driver is deprecated and not maintained in years in Openstack is precisely because of how onerous this process is. We invested time and money in this porcess, we hired a contractor familiar with the Openstack process and its ecosystem (many thanks, Mark!), and we were ready to address reasonable code review comments (many of the comments in this specific review *do* make sense). However, asking us to drop python 2 support or maintain two (N?) code bases for each cinder release going back to ... Newton? is unreasonable. We are a very small company and we simply do not have the bandwidth to maintain such a code base.

Python 2 to 3 migration was the messiest language migration I have ever seen in my life, and I am sure you all felt the effects in Openstack itself, and whatever you say, it is not yet complete (since Havana): https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/pike/python35.html

We invested a lot time and effort in making our code work in both python 2 and 3 and we are not going to break this paradigm now.

Unfortunately, if the whole community feels this way (that code should be only python3 compatible), then we have no other choice but to continue to support our driver via github repo.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-10 20:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Our company put a lot of effort in doing "the right thing" -
 > upstream the cinder driver properly, run CI, etc.. The reason our
 > driver is deprecated and not maintained in years in Openstack is
 > precisely because of how onerous this process is. We invested time
 > and money in this porcess, we hired a contractor familiar with the
 > Openstack process and its ecosystem (many thanks, Mark!), and we
 > were ready to address reasonable code review comments (many of the
 > comments in this specific review *do* make sense). However, asking
 > us to drop python 2 support or maintain two (N?) code bases for
 > each cinder release going back to ... Newton? is unreasonable. We
 > are a very small company and we simply do not have the bandwidth to
 > maintain such a code base.
 >

 > ever seen in my life, and I am sure you all felt the effects in
 > Openstack itself, and whatever you say, it is not yet complete
 > (since Havana): https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/pike/python35.html

 > We invested a lot time and effort in making our code work in both
 > python 2 and 3 and we are not going to break this paradigm now.
 > 
 > Unfortunately, if the whole community feels this way (that code
 > should be only python3 compatible), then we have no other choice
 > but to continue to support our driver via github repo.

If the driver had been maintained, then there would be a functioning version of the driver for each of the releases you would like to provide. Unfortunately the lesson of diverging forks is learned again.

It sounds like maintaining in your own GitHub repo is the best option if you do not want to follow upstream development.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-13 01:47:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Since this came up in today's Cinder weekly meeting, I want to add the content of my email response here so that others can comment on it.

Before we get into details, I just wanted to say on behalf of the entire upstream Cinder team that we are really happy that Datera has been working to get the driver reinstated as 'supported' upstream.  We think that it makes for a stronger Cinder community when vendors are closely involved with the project, and in the long run, a better product for OpenStack users.

One more general point about OpenStack releases and branches.  The open source nature of OpenStack means that the development velocity of any particular project, for example Cinder, is difficult to predict.  There may be some development cycles where a lot happens and others not so much.  So each release is its own little ecosystem that's kept stable by keeping a cap on what dependencies are allowed and what library versions can be used and making sure that risky changes that could destabilize that Cinder release aren't backported.  And you never know exactly how great the set of differences from one release to the next will be.  So in general, if someone developed a completely new backend driver for Ussuri, we wouldn't expect that it could be used with Newton because it's been developed and tested with only the most recent libraries and Cinder code.  (But that's in general; careful design, coding, and especially thorough testing might make it possible, but it wouldn't just happen.)

Anyway, that's why we have this model of stable releases, to which appropriate bugfixes may be backported, but no features.  And yes, it is a pain to have to figure out whether a fix is appropriate for backport to each branch.  (We have to live with that too in Cinder itself.)  But it's the only workflow we've been able to figure out that can keep the stable branches stable for the people who are using that release.

As far as the Python 3 situation goes, Ussuri is only being tested upstream with Python 3.6 and 3.7.  We had a recent policy discussion that resulted in these reviewing guidelines: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703709/2 .   They allow drivers to continue to use Python-2-compatible code.   But keep in mind that as OpenStack and the other open source libraries it depends on develop, it may not be possible to keep a driver that works in trunk also working in stable branches.  I'm only mentioning that so you can make a realistic assessment of what you're getting into.

To summarize: we'd really like to see the Datera driver in-tree and marked as 'supported' in Ussuri.

So as far as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704153/ goes ... I think we can work out issues there, but keep in mind that the intent of allowing Python-2-compatible code is to make backporting bugfixes easy, not to maintain the driver only in master use it in earlier branches.  In keeping with that, it might be a good idea to break the patch into multiple submissions.  The idea is to structure your changes to master so that they can be backported easily as bugfixes to into the stable branches.  For example, one patch would re-enable the driver as SUPPORTED, and you could have one or several bugfxes in other patches that could then be backported to stable branches if necessary.  Our experience has been that when each patch is a focused change, it's easier to backport fixes.  (Plus smaller changes tend to be reviewed faster.)  But it's up to you.

I hope I've addressed your questions and comments.  If not, I'm willing to set up a video conference.  It may be easier to talk rather than try to write all this stuff out."}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2020-02-15 04:48:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

For everyone's benefit, copying here offline email thread:

-------
Thank you for the detailed email, I really appreciate it!


Let me try to address the issues inline:


On Wed, Feb 26, 2020 at 9:21 AM Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hello Virgil,

> Sorry about the delayed reply.  Here's how things are looking from our side:

> 0. You have your third-party CI running ... excellent!

> 1. You can keep py2 compat code; we are allowing it in drivers
Thanks, that is great news! 

> 2. You can submit https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709856/ as one big
patch, but keep in mind that that patch is not backportable to the
stable branches
I do understand that, this would be Ussuri and onwards, correct? And I do understand that any potential bugfixes would have to go to Ussuri specifically and any potential future OS release branch (e.g V release) 

> 3. In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709856/, please make sure that the
version number on the driver is increased.  We suggest that you make it
a major version change to make clear that this is a new,
non-backward-compat version of the driver
Makes sense. 

> 4. As far as the submit-a-new-driver idea goes: you could do that, but
then it would have to be py3 only.  I don't think it's necessary to
submit a new driver as long as you have clear versioning to indicate
what version of the driver is the Ussuri+ driver.
I would clearly prefer to keep the current name/directory structure if possible, I was just trying to explain the huge patch size and find a work around if needed.

> 5. If you want to fix bugs in pre-ussuri code that's currently in-tree,
you can submit via the regular process, namely, submit directly to
stable/train to get the ball rolling.
> Unfortunately, that code is too old for that. We would have to keep the current out-of-the-tree driver model for OS releases up to Train, which our customers already use - they don't use the in-tree version currently. Does that make sense?

> As far as your hope or expectation that customers can use this driver
with previous releases ... you will have to test that on your own.
Upstream, we only have tests across stable branches (so train version of
a driver with train, stein with stein, etc.).  Also keep in mind that
when, for example, a Train distribution of openstack is packaged, it
will contain the Datera driver that's in the stable/train branch.
Yes, understood. We already have internal CI jobs that verify our driver against previous releases (up to Train), that we plan to keep running and maintain internally. 

> I think that covers the points that have come up previously in this
thread.  If there are still open issues, it may be best to set up a
quick videoconference so we can discuss in real time.

Once again, I really appreciate the time spent on this, we will push a new patch trying to address some of the other comments and hopefully this can make it in the tree in time for Ussuri."}, {'account_id': 10298, 'date': '2020-03-02 21:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-03-02 22:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Thanks to Sean and Walt for doing all the heavy lifting reviewing this.  Comment inline about the version history issue.

Mark & Virgil: I don't want to make this patch any bigger than it is, so I think you should file a blueprint in Launchpad (something like datera-driver-restoration) and then we can track the follow up stuff there.  What I mean is that after this thing is merged, you'll need to:
- update the driver matrix doc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-24 13:30:54.000000000', 'message': '{WIP} Update in-tree Datera Cinder driver

New attempt to update Datera Cinder in-tree driver. This review request
builds on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661359/ with fixed zuul gating
tests.

Full list of changes since last update:

* Added Pypi packaging installation support
* Dropping support for v2 API.  No Datera products exist in production
  with this API version.
* Added v2.2 API support
* Rewrite of the driver to use the Datera Python-SDK instead of
  hand-rolled connections.  Usage requires the dfs_sdk python package
* Dropping support for default_storage_name and default_volume_name
  volume-type keys
* Added CHAP support
* Implemented fast-path Glance-->Datera image cloning with clone_image RPC
* Implemented fast-path volume retype
* Rewrote unit tests from scratch
* Added iops_per_gb and bandwidth_per_gb volume-type keys
* Implemented update_migrated_volume
* Increased number of stats reported with get_volume_stats
* API fallback now only occurs during driver initialization.  This
  increases driver performance
* Added config option for customizing volume-type default values
* Implemented template size override
* Implemented LDAP support
* Added support for filter_functions and goodness_functions
* Changed version string to date-based
* Implemented manage_existing_snapshot and related RPCs

Change-Id: I56a1a24d60a7bc0dc59bfcfa89da23f43696a31e

commit_message:
Update in-tree Datera Cinder driver

New attempt to update Datera Cinder in-tree driver. This review request
builds on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661359/ with fixed zuul gating
tests.

Full list of changes since last update:

* Added Pypi packaging installation support
* Dropping support for v2 API.  No Datera products exist in production
  with this API version.
* Added v2.2 API support
* Rewrite of the driver to use the Datera Python-SDK instead of
  hand-rolled connections.  Usage requires the dfs_sdk python package
* Dropping support for default_storage_name and default_volume_name
  volume-type keys
* Added CHAP support
* Implemented fast-path Glance-->Datera image cloning with clone_image RPC
* Implemented fast-path volume retype
* Rewrote unit tests from scratch
* Added iops_per_gb and bandwidth_per_gb volume-type keys
* Implemented update_migrated_volume
* Increased number of stats reported with get_volume_stats
* API fallback now only occurs during driver initialization.  This
  increases driver performance
* Added config option for customizing volume-type default values
* Implemented template size override
* Implemented LDAP support
* Added support for filter_functions and goodness_functions
* Changed version string to date-based
* Implemented manage_existing_snapshot and related RPCs
* Removed ancient py25 compatibility imports
* Updated Copyright to 2020
* Fixed almost all requests From walter and Sean
* Added comprehensive version history

Change-Id: I56a1a24d60a7bc0dc59bfcfa89da23f43696a31e

commit_message:
Update pyScss to 1.3.7

pyScss v1.3.7 doesn't require any bindep to be installed so it's prefer
to use it instead of adding bindep to all projects manually.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/715240

Change-Id: I336a3449c1ed8be3984da6366e9b45f8e4d3f5c0

commit_message:
BaR Always do MySQL dumps even the services wont be stopped

Do MySQL dump even though the services are not managed and stopped
during the backup process

Change-Id: I54891bcb28ba082f05ce705492a14bf93bba2f66

subject: Update upper-constraints for pyScss to 1.3.7
messages:
[{'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's still not clear to me why this cannot wait for the bot to update the constraint.

You state that 1.3.6 does not require a bindep, should it?  If yes that may be a reason to update to 1.3.7 but I still need to know why it's so urgent (is a project blocked?)"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

ok, commit message updated, makes more sense, 1.3.7 doesn't require a bindep, which is good.

I still need to know why this is urgent"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As of now, all horizon plugin gates are failing due to missing libprec3-dev (unless projects already install libprec3-dev from some other reasons). pyScss <1.3.6 does not work with setuptools 46, so our current choices from horizon plugin perspective are to add libpcre3-dev or to use pyscss 1.3.7. This is the reason e0ne proposed this without waiting for the update constraints job.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We need v1.3.7 to unblock horizon plugins gates and be able to backport to stable/* branches too because horizon stable gates are broken too now'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

kk, thanks for the reasoning'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks a lot for the quick review, Matthew!'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I'll keep this as WIP until CI for https://review.opendev.org/715241 will be happy"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

not published yet?

commit_message:
Update upper-constraints for pyScss to 1.3.7

 pyScss v1.3.7 doesn't require any bindep to be installed so it's prefer
 to use it instead of adding bindep to all projects manually.

Change-Id: I9f48135e4b63dbc3c9321c1daa5d4bd229dec001

[{'created': '2020-03-26 16:57:11.000000000', 'message': 'Nova: Update compute start script for console

[0] added route command to identify multiple default routes.
In some deployments, route command is not available which set the
client_interface value incorrectly. In this case VNC clinet tries
to connect to default host 127.0.0.1 and fails.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696187

Change-Id: I4a936af053114988e0b70048e276a71833c5638e
'}]
commit_message:
Nova: Update compute start script for console

[0] added route command to identify multiple default routes.
In some deployments, route command is not available which set the
client_interface value incorrectly. In this case VNC clinet tries
to connect to default host 127.0.0.1 and fails.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696187

Change-Id: I4a936af053114988e0b70048e276a71833c5638e

commit_message:
Pass accelerator requests to each virt driver from compute manager.

Update the signature of the spawn() API for each virt driver
to include accel_info, which is a list of accelerator requests.

Change-Id: I4aac66c125a162bf35991a7d0c2638c7475ec0e7
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction
