I don't know the genesis of the environment/services directory, but all the other cinder environment files are in the parent environment directory. I agree duplicate files should be deleted, so let's delete environments/services/cinder-backup.yaml.

Also, the documentation (at least the downstream docs) refer to the file in the environments directory."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-03-26 15:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the feedback.

"}, {'created': '2020-03-26 15:06:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove duplicated cinder-backup.yaml

environments/service directory, and these two files have the exact

Let's remove the one in services directory to have only a single

commit_message:
Remove duplicated cinder-backup.yaml

Currently we have cinder-backup.yaml under environments directory and
environments/service directory, and these two files have the exact
same content.

Let's remove the one in services directory to have only a single
file, and also have all the cinder-related environment files in
the same level.

Change-Id: Ic1ade94ee5895ed96c815db84481f81c896fddfa

commit_message:
Add Pygments to upper-constraints

Pygments is already in global-requirements, but not in
upper-constraints. Pygments is required by Sphinx.

Pygments removed support for py2 in version 2.6.0 so we
need to ensure that it is properly pinned to prevent
tests/docs failing.

Pygments was added to the blacklist in
I643c7632a02c87820c9c51f03fa34f0764384783 but it's not
entirely clear why. To ensure that it is managed in
upper-constraints from now on, we remove it from the
blacklist.

Change-Id: I18a50482e588176047ede81c4ee994c9d7df282b
Closes-Bug: #1869174

VHD is there was some really weird old reason, and since qcow2 is
supported as well - use it as default.

commit_message:
Add Pygments to upper-constraints

Pygments is already in global-requirements, but not in
upper-constraints. Pygments is required by Sphinx.

Pygments removed support for py2 in version 2.6.0 so we
need to ensure that it is properly pinned to prevent
tests/docs failing.

Pygments was added to the blacklist in
I643c7632a02c87820c9c51f03fa34f0764384783 but it's not
entirely clear why. To ensure that it is managed in
upper-constraints from now on, we remove it from the
blacklist.

Change-Id: I18a50482e588176047ede81c4ee994c9d7df282b
Closes-Bug: #1869174

commit_message:
Re-add support for python 3.5

cliff is used by stestr which is used by more things than just
openstack projects - one of them being zuul which still supports
python 3.5. Let's keep supporting 3.5 here for now.

Change-Id: I14fca07853677d041215649cb55caf1e0dc49753

commit_message:
Add server_keystone_endpoint_type param to heat::engine

Adds the server_keystone_endpoint_type config option [1].

This is available all the way back from Stein and will
therefore be backported.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/common/config.py#L99

Change-Id: Ia251802612e7a4cf5c6828f3b7c1a0ef63a3c069

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 18:31:10.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamically adjust the retires value to fit the deployment

This change will adjust the retries value based on deployment options which will
ensure a greater degree of success. Without this change the playbooks assumed all
introspection jobs would be complete within 1000 seconds, however, if a deployer
is running a large scale deployment its very likely the job would require more
time, especially when dealing with hundreds of nodes. To ensure the highest degree
of success, the playbook will now adjust retry values ensuring that every node gets
at least 600 seconds to complete introspection.

Change-Id: Ife45605cc5cd2789019f56350a17f57744b31dda
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Dynamically adjust the retires value to fit the deployment

This change will adjust the retries value based on deployment options which will
ensure a greater degree of success. Without this change the playbooks assumed all
introspection jobs would be complete within 1000 seconds, however, if a deployer
is running a large scale deployment its very likely the job would require more
time, especially when dealing with hundreds of nodes. To ensure the highest degree
of success, the playbook will now adjust retry values ensuring that every node gets
at least 600 seconds to complete introspection.

Change-Id: Ife45605cc5cd2789019f56350a17f57744b31dda
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Switch to futurist for concurrency"

This partially reverts commit b6a22e3749555ecf9fea762dfc4935e312f6d8bb.

The addition of futurist as a hard depend broke python2, and at the
same time didn't mark the release as having done so. In looking at the
issue we realized that we don't actually need the hard depend.

Change-Id: I2d874f618f5b3f66d49cd2e964c6e05655f22c0f

commit_message:
Bust import caching of xstatic package namespaces

When iterating over xstatic packages which haven't had the benefit
of pip install creating explicit namespace packages for them, we
reset the implicit namespaces which may linger from earlier imports.

Change-Id: Ie6fe282c9d06f0147e37bbe2cf6de9d9c3f0eb39

commit_message:
Revert "Drop all Rocky jobs from both check and gate queues"

This reverts commit de952714e262f88c927ab6bb2cc5dfbb5daaf9c7.

Change-Id: Ie50d475777668293c7d5d29539059470c50014d6

commit_message:
Refactorize test_tht_ansible_syntax to welcome new roles/modules

tripleo-ansible isn't the only source of roles and modules, we also have
modules in ansible-pacemaker for example, and more. We need to make the
THT ansible syntax check able to also include these in the testing.

Change-Id: Ieb089d20fced84bf44980d35b88ba20964545b7f

commit_message:
Disable podsecuritypolicy job

The current podsecuritypolicy job has not been passing for quite
a while. Disable it for now until it's fixed to avoid wasting
infra resources.

Change-Id: I14b184cf03e625cbbaa829a4de101dc2142a7e27

commit_message:
Cap Pygments <2.6.0 for Python 2.7

Running Pygments on Python 2.x is no longer supported
since version 2.6.0.

Change-Id: Ifcef92c01858c645135d4abda29572bd8b40e131
Related-Bug: #1869166
